Reviews.Title: “A decent option”
Reviews.Author: JokoEaston
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews on the site before staying at the hotel. I had some concerns about the location but in all honesty it wasn't that bad. If you want the touristy feel to where you are staying then this is not the hotel for you. But if you want a decent hotel at an ok price this is a good home base for seeing NYC. We go to NYC multiple times a year and we love to walk everywhere. This was perfect for walking to the world trade center area and we spent the rest of our time in the meatpacking/soho area. If you have the chance definitely try to get to the end of the high line down in the meatpacking district. It was beautiful. So back to the hotel...it was very clean...the room not a bad size considering we were in NYC...the staff was so nice. We didn't try the hotel restaurant b/c we prefer to find something while we are out and about. Take a walk down 6th street (Avenue of the Americas) and try the French Roast for breakfast, it's probably 10-15+ blocks from the hotel. We also didn't realize how many restaurants there were in the meatpacking district which we will try the next time. I would defintely not worry about the area at night. On a Friday night it was pretty quiet around the hotel. Yes it is on a busy street but we walked from the train station on 34th so it didn't matter to us. There were several parking garages in the area and the subway was very close.

Reviews.Title: “A REALLY GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Joel R
Reviews.Content: This is a really great place to stay. First off, the staff makes sure that everything is great. Managers Priscilla and her assistant Dawn straightened out a National reservation mistake and made sure that we were more than satisfied with the results. The computer system in the lobby is free and good, I used my computer on their wireless in the lobby for free, (in room has a charge). The staff greeted us each time we entered and made sure they helped us if we needed anything. The place is new and clean. Maps and travel info was plentiful and the staff again helped us numerous times with the subway and other instructions. Try the restaurant right next door; great food, reasonably priced, great selection, and open 24 hours. Great location also.

Reviews.Title: “Did it's job”
Reviews.Author: Frontera2
Reviews.Content: Visited New York for 5 nights in February 2012, and booked the hotel via priceline.com so only paid around £70 a night which, for New York, isn't bad at all. Upon arrival, we requested a twin room (I'd also made the request by email prior to arrival) only to be told that they didn't have any available. Athough my friend and I are good friends - we aren't * that * close and had no desire to share a bed. However after a couple of minutes the receptionist managed to find a suitable room for us and at no extra charge. The room we were given was on the second floor of the hotel and came with a suprisingly large balcony - alas with it being February it wasn't exactly the sort of weather to sit outside although the weather was nice during the stay. The room itself was fairly small, with limited space for 2 people to hang clothes. The beds themselves were very comfortable and ensured a good nights sleep. Limited amount of complimentary coffee provided but not tea which was a shame. Bathroom was a decent size with a very powerful shower and a deep bath. Left a tip for the chambermaid each day and got a nice note in return each evening when we returned which I thought was a nice touch. Wi-Fi in the hotel is not free except in the lobby and quite expensive compared to what I'm used to in the US. Didn't use any of the hotel facilities other than a couple of drinks in the pleasant bar. All in all, a pleasant enough stay - especially given that there a number of subway stations within a couple of minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - attentiveness as rarely seen”
Reviews.Author: paolowill
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed there, and I am amazed, a year later, that the service from ALL hotel employees is still at such a high level. Cudos to the hotel manager, Lowell, who I had the chance to speak with. He is a constant presence in the lobby during busy periods, and the staff reflects his enthusisam for fine service. All are immediately ready to assist - politely approaching guests to see if they may help with a cab, your bags, or any questions you may have. Exceptional service for NYC or anywhere. Paul from RI will be back, Lowell! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in soho”
Reviews.Author: MusiBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: Although rooms aren't big, they are ok. The gym is good, the breakfast is quite expensive, but they have a starbucks coffee in the reception! Free Internet in the lobby, and 1 block from soho. The hotel is on canal st that it isn't very nice but is not dangerous. This hotel accept pets. The price is very reasonable for being in Soho, and it is brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Lucas W
Reviews.Content: Fun Hotel that was nice and clean in a great location. All the employees went out of their way but David the valet went the extra mile every time we needed him.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay for a Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: ktattai
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean, updated rooms. Great lobby bar. Only downfall is that it's on Canal street. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Near Soho / comfortable beds / business traveler vibe”
Reviews.Author: neige8
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for 2 weeks prior to moving into our apartment. We chose the Sheraton because it allowed dogs, was close to several subway lines, was near soho and had a good rate. The hotel has a business traveler vibe. The bar/ lounge area is not hip or trendy and the chair cushions had quite a few stains on them. There is coffee bar in the lobby that serves Starbucks coffee in the morning- big plus if you need coffee to get your day going. Rooms: Clean, big comfortable beds, new modern bathrooms. (No bedbug issues). Placement of the tv was a bit odd- needs to be on a arm so it can be adjusted. We payed a bit extra for a skyline view, which was really nice at night. Location: The area right outside of the hotel is not wonderful- but walk 1 block north and you are in soho or go south and you can find some great restaurants in Tribeca. Easy access to the subway. Staff: Everyone was extremely friendly to us and our dog.

Reviews.Title: “Good Lower Manhattan Location”
Reviews.Author: Trekking48
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Tribeca is located right in the heart of Canal Street and is a good base of operations for lower Manhattan. The hotel is very clean and for NYC the rooms are a good size. Also the room rates are good, again keeping the location in mind. Excellent options to explore the island by subway or taxi. Free wi-fi is a nice touch. I found the staff friendly and the 21st floor lounge access provides a good breakfast and a wonderful outdoor patio with great views. I did not eat at the main floor restaurant, come on it is New York after all with plenty of restaurant options. About 30 minutes from LaGuardia in good traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Nice modern room”
Reviews.Author: katie5199
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel - very clean and comfortable with modern decor. There was a fantastic deal online for $169 a night plus tax (a "deluxe room" - a bit larger than regular room - with a king-sized bed) and we paid an extra $10 to stay in a room with a view of the city on the 18th floor. Had a fantastic night's sleep! The hotel was just a five minute walk away from the subway (Canal Street) and also minutes away from some great galleries in SoHo and restaurants in Tribeca. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central location”
Reviews.Author: yohagopelo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my mom (she was visiting me in NYC). Overall, the hotel was very clean, in a convenient location and the staff was very friendly. The room was a decent size for NYC. Other pluses: free gym, computers/wi-fi in the lobby, no bugs (I obsessively checked) One things I'd like to state for people traveling with pets - Since I live in NY, I didn't check in with my dog. I went back to Brooklyn and got him so he could stay with my mom for a night or two (he is small - 7 pounds). When I brought him, I let the hotel know and they provided a bed and bowl. The first night, no incident. The second night, my mom and I went to dinner and when we came back to the hotel room, my dog was GONE. There was a note on the bed saying he was at the front desk. Turns out, someone complained that he barked so they removed him. This was pretty disturbing. Again, the hotel staff was SUPER friendly - my dog seemed fine and in good hands. But to remove my dog from the room without my consent? They said we had signed a waiver allowing them to do so, but we were never given a waiver (of course they had us sign one right then). I had my husband come pick up the dog then as I didn't want our pup to be a nuisance nor to be put in a situation like this again, however people traveling with pets from out of town wouldn't have this luxury. Make sure you are clear on this hotel's pet policy & what they will do if your dog barks.

Reviews.Title: “great new hotel, perfect for a Soho/Tribeca visit”
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: Really nice new hotel with reasonable pricing and small but functional rooms (about normal for NY, though smaller than Le Parker Meridien and other higher-priced places). Rooms were new and clean, with great hookup center for computer/dvd player into tv and nice work desk and chair. Was kindly recognized as an SPG Goldmember and got upgraded to a nice club room with pretty city view. Club is beautiful here, with great views from the club terrace and nice outdoor couches. Biggest issue was the need to swipe your card in the elevator, which sometimes just couldn't read your card, so i (and several others) were stuck several times waiting to have someone else make a lucky swipe, or swiping repeatedly until it worked, while the elevator went around on its own. Although other reviewers complained of noise from Canal Street, we were on a high floor and never heard any traffic noise. Other than the elevators, the bed was great, room and bathroom was great (with cool new shower), and location was great for a funky chinatown pubcrawl/long walk to to the village. Always appreciate the free Starbucks coffee. Will come again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: mizo101
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a company wide seminar on how to treat customers. Customer service does not exist. My husband had a business trip in New York and I tagged along for several days. He left very early Monday morning for work and I was in the hotel room by myself when I realized that the linens on the bed had a stain of poop! Grossed that I had slept on it, I called the front desk. They were neither apologetic nor sensed the grossness of the situation. The front desk notified me that they would be sending someone. They sent one male janitor who came into the room to change the sheets. Again, no apology or anything. About 30 minutes later, still in my PJ's and about to get into the shower, the same male janitor knocked on my door. There had been no call from the front desk so I was wary of opening my door. I opened it and stood at the front door asking what he wanted. He claimed he left his master key inside my room. I told him I had not seen any key but he barged in the room and started searching for it himself. At this point, I was really uncomfortable. Our room was in the corner, I was by myself, and this strange man was basically looking through my stuff. Of course, he didn't find anything and left. I was late for an appointment and didn't stop by the front desk to tell what happened. I came back into the hotel in the late afternoon and asked to see the manager. When I told her of what happened, again, she wasn't very concerned, was condescending, and kept asking me what the big deal the situation was. She referred me to the housekeeping manager who sent me a small box of chocolates to ease the situation. We left the next day. Their valet policy is to call the front desk 30 minutes in advance and they will have the car waiting in the front. (I think the place where they park is actually pretty far and that's how long it takes to walk and drive back). We called it in the next morning at 6am. My flight was leaving at 8:30 so we were cutting it close. We came downstairs after the allotted time to find the wrong car sitting in the front. We informed the front desk that it was the wrong car and they had to call over to the valet deck. Instead of hurrying and trying to get our car back to the hotel, the front desk was more concerned with whose fault they got the number wrong. We didn't care as long as the car got to the hotel ASAP. It took them another 30 minutes to do so. The charge was $49 per night for valet, so my husband wanted to see if they could waiver the last night's valet charge for their mistakes. It has been horrible trying to talk to anyone. No manger has called back. The customer service is non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, but pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Xpacker
Reviews.Content: Cons: The rooms can be very tiny, and the elevators are frustratingly slow. The front desk ladies can be a little gruff. In the morning, the cleaning staff sometimes chattered in very loud voices right next to the door. Pros: Fantastic location! The room is pleasant and the bathroom spacious; both have updated decor. David T. was very friendly and always extremely helpful -- a gem! The "quiet" room we asked for was *very* quiet -- only heard external noises once, other than the cleaning crew. Excellent business office setup. All in all, very satisfactory stay. Steps away from just about every major subway line, or else a couple of blocks from excellent neighborhoods such as Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, and Chelsea. So very easy to get anywhere in the City. David T. was knowledgeable and very helpful and friendly. Plenty of computers in the business office, which is in a lively part of the lobby -- very nice to check email and Google Maps. First 5-6 pages print for free. Highly recommend it -- would stay there again, for business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Thu - Fri Stay - Touring NYC”
Reviews.Author: P L
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Wednesday and were greeted nicely. The lower lobby was amusing with people chatting and surfing. We walked 5 blocks to Mott St where we had some "Wonton Noodle" dinner. The staff were very pleasant with us, and especially David (Concierge) on our last day helped us by locating a last minute cab to JFK. Allow at least 45 minutes to get there from the hotel. The subway station is just in the corner, as well as a post office and even a notary a couple of blocks out. Next door there is a mini deli that is open 24 hr so you are never short of any snacks or even meals. They have a salad and lunch/dinner bar by weight, so it's very pleasant to have choices. I did not give the hotel 5 stars because internet is not available in the rooms, as is in most hotels nowadays, unless for an extra charge. You already have restricted parking, and the internet is also restricted to the first floor lobby only. Other than that I'd recommend this location to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TheFongalis
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for both business and pleasure. The rooms are ok sized with a huge comfortable bed and a new fresh bathroom. Excellent location, right by Soho. A good selection of great restaurants close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden modern gem at the top of Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: WestonMOCook
Reviews.Content: Manager Lowell Beebe-Center is not just available, he's accessible. And apparently he's instilled the entire staff with a friendliness and service mentality that is downright gracious without being cloying. The sparkle of the fairly new hotel is maintained to a high level of cleanliness. Opt for a room with club level privileges - the lounge is one of the best we've seen. As for prices, very mid-line for Manhattan. And of course, location, location, location. Walk to literally hundreds of restaurants; easy trek to SoHo. We've tried bunches of Manhattan hotels - it is going to be hard to get us to try another one.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: This independently owned Sheraton refused to refund us after we had to cancel our trip due to Hurricane Irene. Poor leadership and bad customer service describe my experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “$60 parking , no in and out !!”
Reviews.Author: chicagotraveler9411
Reviews.Content: Had a rough time trying to check in due to lack of valet attendants and parking area in front of hotel. We were initially in 2 double bed room on the top floor (22 nd). The room smelled like mold, due to the shower curtain. I got the head of housekeeping who was quite rude although I got her to admit the smell was overwhelming. We were moved to a different room with 1 king with a a pull out sofa which was a challenge for 4 people. Except for the housekeepIng supervisor the front desk staff was friendly. The location was decent within walking distance to Katz deli and several other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for all NYC has to offer”
Reviews.Author: kinzCO
Reviews.Content: The best part of the Sheraton is the location to 3 different subway lines. You can get almost anywhere in midtown Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens from this hotel in 30 minutes. The hotel is new and updated and the rooms are very good sized for New York City. Our room's only drawback was the lack of a mini-fridge and the 'peek-a-boo' city views from our room on the 17th floor. The majority of our view was the back of the post office. There is great food and shopping only minutes away! Bagel deli next door is much better than hotel breakfast and is open all night!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: BJW_12
Reviews.Content: really happy with this hotel...stayed in May 2011 for a week, 15th Floor with a view of mid and uptown - fantastic...canal st where the hotel is a bit "gritty" but gives you a real sense of NYC...the area around the hotel has amazing shopping in soho, similarly with bars adn restaurants..head south from the hotel to tribeca and again the restaurants are brilliant..well served by the subway a better location i think would be hard to find if you want to see some real New York and not jsut the bits the books tell you see! Room was fairly spacios, good facilties in the hotel including the all important starbucks stand...didnt pay the standard extortionate price circa$20 for breakfast as immediately next door there is a really cool joint thats open 24/7 that does just about every breakfast under the sun staff in the hotel were really good, the gym was a decent size and i really couldnt find fault with it... Ive been in NYC before and paid a fortune to stay in "better" places but none compared to here Would definitely go here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Olive54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight for a tiny getaway. We were very happy with the hotel. The room and the view were beautiful. Everyone we talked to were so friendly and helpful –the staff is truly a pleasure! The club level was was great. It had a great view of the Empire State Building and offered great food and drinks. The primary location on Canal St. could have been a little nicer but it is very close to many desirable locations. We would definitley stay again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Sheraton Tribeca!”
Reviews.Author: rawaspecial
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews I was a little apprehensive upon arrival especially since we had booked our trip through an agency.... LOCATION The Sheraton's location is just ok - on Canal Street which is on the edge to Chinatown (we thought not so nice unfortunately!) but also quite close to the more "in" area of Tribeca and when you walk up Broadway you have nice, though expensive shops to look at and a very nice, clean and safe area when walking further uptown. We walked Broadway (uptown) as well as West Broadway (uptown) even at night and felt safe. However, we did not like walking in the other direction towards Chinatown, as we felt unsafe there - just our impression. But location was the only not so great thing about this hotel. ROOMS When we were checked in, we were given two rooms on the executive floor. The rooms were good in size, clean and not too loud - you did hear sirens and a car alarm every now and then but that happens everywhere in NYC! The Sheraton also has wonderful beds! Our rooms had a (for our standards) huge double bed with great clean sheets & more than enough fluffy pillows! This was great for us, since we had to stay in bed more than we had wanted to due to an illness. On our 3rd day I had to contact the front office re a doctor and was told by staff they have a doctor who makes house calls. They contacted him for us and he called us at our room later. He arrived in the early afternoon and was very nice and competent. STARWOOD PREFERRED GUEST LOUNGE We stayed on the floor where the Starwood Preferred Guest lounge is located and where we got free breakfast, evening snacks and free soft drinks! It was just great! The lounge even has a wonderful terrace - too bad it was winter! There's also a computer in the lounge which you can use for free for a certain period of time each day (I think it was around an hour or less?), but there were also a couple of computers for free use in the lobby. Due to the time change we were up very early each day and always the first ones for breakfast so we got to talking to the lounge attendants a lot! They were all very kind and helpful if you needed any extras! STAFF We thought the staff was great! From the minute we checked in, we got wonderful and very competent and friendly service, whether it was at the front office, the concierge, housekeeping personnel, the lounge attendants etc. They all went out of their way for us! All in all we would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IF SOHO IS WHERE YOU WANT TO BE”
Reviews.Author: Marc A
Reviews.Content: Had a GREAT weekend stay Feb 25-27, 2012. The staff could not be more helpful and pofessional. If you want a GREAT location and GREAT staff book this Hotel. Night time can be a bit intimIdating if you are not familiar with the area however I have been coming to this area for 20 years and have never felt unsafe, even when catching a subway train at 3:00 AM to JFK. This Hotel is value priced for New York city and the SOHO area.

Reviews.Title: “More like Sheraton Try Better”
Reviews.Author: L3506041
Reviews.Content: This should not be a Sheraton. It shouldn't even be a Sheraton 4 Points. It is on dumpy Canal Street. Rooms are small even by NYC standards. Service is rude. I've stayed in close to 200 hotels so far and this is by far the worst. Just appalling. Sheraton should hanging their heads in shame for allowing their big red logo to hang of this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: feelinlucky
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here recently. Bid $110 the rooms on Priceline so it was a good value. Great rooms, nice people working there. 100% satisfied with the place. The only thing they could do better is lower the cost of valet parking ($55). I found other parking in lots in the area and was able to print out discount coupons. Paid $29 for 24 hours. Location is at the bottom of SoHo, close to Chinatown and Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, learn the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Gtraveladvisor
Reviews.Content: Great Rooms! The hallways and interiors are a bit cramped; you will hear those in a room nearby if they are noisy. Canal Street is very crowded, if you want to avoid the crowds, west of the hotel is the way to venture. These small issues are mitigated by the rooms and prices, which are very good for a quality hotel in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca..really?”
Reviews.Author: oneLmichele1111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on Canal street. The outside is not attractive at all. The rooms are small(many are in NYC). Service adequate. Either Sheraton's are going in down in class or this hotel should have been a Four Points. There are many cool boutique hotels in NYC for the same price. The roof top bar is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Understaffed and overcommercialized.”
Reviews.Author: Pelfrey_Duryea
Reviews.Content: This isn't a Courtyard or Four Points; act like a hotel, not a motel. No one was available to assist with luggage or parking when we arrived, which is clearly essential on busy Canal Street -- we had to go in and dig someone up ourselves. Then we were told on departure that it would be at least a half-hour to retrieve the car. From where -- Jersey? Further, the Coca-Cola branding of the entranceway, lobby, and restaurant is distasteful and ugly. This and service spoil an otherwise perfectly serviceable and attractive hotel in a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in Soho”
Reviews.Author: 12Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during New York Fashion week. This hotel might not not be trendy but the location in walking distance from fashionable Soho is a great deal for a long weekend. The rooms are in standard size with nice and comfy beds, it is quite and you can have a great view on Manhattan from the higher floors. Staff is friendly, nice breakfast for a very low price, small Starbucks in the lobby as well. If you are looking for a good hotel in NY for a very affordable price, this is for sure a good pick.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Stay At this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenandblue63
Reviews.Content: My husband, 17 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in February 2012. We reserved a suite. The room was pretty spacious considering it is NY. There was a king size bed, fold out couch and a 4 seater table to dine at if you wanted. The room and bathroom were both very clean. The gym is pretty good- treadmills, cross trainers, free weights and a weights machine. There's a nice bar and a restaurant although we didn't eat in the restaurant. There is a great deli next door for bagels muffins, sandwiches, juice, wine & beer. There's also a Starbucks inside the hotel for your espresso fix if you need one. Overall the hotel was above average. The staff were consistently friendly and helpful. In fact, I can't say enough about the outstanding service. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in the heart of NY's most vibrant area!”
Reviews.Author: Fraser S
Reviews.Content: just wrapped up a great night at the Sheraton Tribeca. The staff is fantastic, and willing to assist with all sorts of requests. They even surprised us with a nice gift at check-in because I'd told them it was a special trip. Room was spacious & clean, had great views, and a really nice bathroom. We'll be back! Only complaint is that the valet only parking, at $65 for our SUV, was a bit steep... so don't drive here...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice service,.....but never eat here”
Reviews.Author: Varito
Reviews.Content: I was one week on business in New York, and since the headquarters of the company I work for is located at 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel, is of the hotels we usually use. Some comments: - good location as start point to see NY. I had to stay there because of my work, but if I would have been on vacations, I also see this hotel as very good option. - nice, helpful and friendly staff. Always open and available to support. - room: small, somehow NY standard, but not Sheraton standard. But clean and in my case, I was on a high floor (15th) with a great view to the Empire State building. The sky was very clear, blue, no clouds, therefore a great view in the night. - fully agree with one comment regarding the noise of the air stractor on the toillete. Amazing loud, that´s why I also decided to use the other light and illuminate the restroom. - breakfast only average.....no ham or cheese but fruits and juice. Nothing special, but ok. - two days during my stay, I had business meetings which ended very late, came back to the hotel close to 10:00PM and decided to order food to the room/room service, and my god !!!!! HORRIBLE FOOD !!!!!. The first time I ordered one chicken stake, which was overkoocked, and I felt eating a piece of leather. However, I decided to give restaurant of the hotel a second chance, and another day ordered a chicken sandwich. Another dissapointment. The chicken again, like leather.....in a baguette like gum.....,so bottom line, the hotel is very nice, well located, close to the subway lines which take you in 15 mins to the uptown, also close to soho and chinatown, with some interesting restaurants and shops nearby.......so no issues to stay a the hotel, but pls DON´T EAT THERE. Believe me. No matter if it´s late, go out and buy something decent.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: KJFamily65
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for lower Manhattan adventures. Walk across the street to SoHo or venture a bit to Little Italy. Treck down Church to the WTC sites. Extremely clean and super-helpful staff. We went w/ kids. Next time, just me and the wife.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, if you want to be there...”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler1959
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the newest in NY, it is a Sheraton and it's in a good location, if you want to be by the Soho/Tribeca, if you want to go shopping in Soho is very convenient. Many subway options around and 5 minutes walking from the shopping area. The problem is that this hotel is not at the Sheraton "level" it should be (As someone already said) a Four Points. The rooms are way too small, we were given a "suite"(As I'm Platinum Strwood) and it was smaller than the "current" Sheraton rooms anywhere else in the country, really a joke... of course the bed is one of the best as always in Sheraton, but the rest of the room not. The bathroom was tiny and the extractor in it is too loud, so much that we prefer to be on the dark rather than hearing that noise (The extractor works when you turn the light on in the bathroom) The lounge is on the top floor, having really nice views of the Hudson River and midtown, really nice views, but the quality of the food ofered was very low. also the service in the lounge was bad. When we were there for the Hours d'ouvre the waiter ofered my wife a glass of wine, our surprise was when he came back later with the check for the glas of wine (9$) WHAT??? you charge for a glas of wine at the Lounge??? All in all, not our best experience in a Sheraton. I would go back only if I HAVE to stay in that area of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, SPG Member Beware”
Reviews.Author: pmv16
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this hotel is in a great location for visiting Little Italy, China Town, Tribeca, and Brooklyn. The area to the right of the hotel is a little seedy, but otherwise it is lively with plenty of sidewalk shopping. The hotel itself is clean and modern with standard Sheraton amenities. On the 21st floor there is a Club Lounge with an amazing outside terrace with an awesome view of the city. I believe Gold (not sure about Gold since the first time we stayed we were not offered free breakfast) and Platinum members can eat breakfast there for free. Food is good, coffee excellent. On our second visit to the hotel in January, we were promised, as now Platinum members, a Suite upgrade. Excited we went to check our room on the 5th floor and were immediately disappointed. The rooms was not much larger than their standard and the view was terrible. The small windows looked out at a brick wall. We then called the front desk, She told us there were no suites available, however we could have a room on the 17th floor with a better view. Of course we took it and it was a beauitiful view, directly across from the Empire State Bldg., but the room was standard, not an upgrade. Upon departure, we did not convey our displeasure due to the fact that they did change our room. However, when I returned home, I immediately contacted Sheraton. I received an apology from them as well as an email contact from the hotel itself with an apology and a promise to do better next time. I am not saying that I would not stay at this property again. It is convenient to visit the above-,mentioned areas for a short trip. We had reservations at Patricia's in Brooklyn which was a short taxi ride away. Patricia's is a great place for good fun and authentic homemade Italian fare. However, I would not choose it if just visiting NYC due to the lack of better treatment for Platinum members.

Reviews.Title: “No street noise, central location”
Reviews.Author: kenzielarae
Reviews.Content: New hotel - wifi (and computers!) in lobby, as well as a Starbuck's, bar and restaurant. Great staff. Room was average, bed was comfortable. I was surprised that we couldn't hear the street noise (I'd just come from a 4 star hotel on a quieter street, and the room on the 31st floor had noticeable street noise). The biggest issue we had was this: though the room was soundproofed, the door to the hallway was not. It was practically a sound amplifier of hallway noises. Of course we got to hear a bunch of teenagers (hotel guests) fighting at 2:30am. We called the from desk, and could hear every word the security guard said. I'd most likely stay again, the location is great. But I'd be sure to bring my noise canceling headphones.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a Starbucks in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: mazydee
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice enough, modern and clean. The bathroom was large and spacious and the beds were really comfortable. Upon checking in, the staff were very efficient and friendly. Were very informed with recommending places to eat and where to catch the subway and getting to places. the hotel has free 30min internet in the lobby which is handy. As was not a Platinum member, was not able to go to the Club Room and take advantage of the lounge bar and take a look at the view, but when I mentioned to the staff that I wanted to take pictures of the view, they called security to escort me to the club room to allow me to take in the views and take photos. It was an amazing view of the city skyline and it was really lovely of them to allow me to see it and go out of their way. The hotel is not far from the Brooklyn bridge and the ground zero location. It is located in Tribeca, however it is more Chinatown- Canal st than Tribeca. The hotel surroundings is a little dirty, old, run down and looks a little scary, but once you walk a few blocks out of the hotel and you are right in SOHO, Tribeca, little Italy and it is lovely. As the moment you walk out of the hotel, you have all the street people trying to sell you fake goods. The hotel lobby area is quite small and you are cramped in however concierge is very helpful and arrange the bags out of the way. As we had a lot of bags with us, they provided us with scales to weigh our bags to make sure we weren't charged by the airlines. Overall, this was quite an enjoyable hotel and i would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great”
Reviews.Author: NanaAnne
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on the internet to stay here for (supposedly) $98. Of course, that's actually about $125 after they add on all the various taxes. My room was small but clean and the bed was very very nice. Bathroom was tiny. I was able to walk to just about anything in Soho and there were plenty of really good restaurants nearby. However, the block the hotel is located in is pretty crummy, the lobby is boring, and the only place you can get wi-fi without paying extra is in the lobby, which I always find irritating. All in all, it's a fairly generic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Highly Accessible Location”
Reviews.Author: DWGPGA
Reviews.Content: Gathering for a weekend family celebration, this hotel and it's staff could not have been more accommodating. Greeted at the curbside with a smile, we "country folk" were immediately put at ease. The valet took care of the car are our belongings followed us to our rooms. Quick and simple. Fantastic view of the city from our rooms (huge windows) and very nice amenities on-site. Quality, tasteful decor, upscale, contemporary, inviting facility. Only a one or two year old hotel, everything is in great condition. The staff seems to enjoy working there and with each other. (Quiet and most effective heating and ventilation in the room.) Reasonable walking distance to Ground Zero, South Street Seaport, Little Italy, Chinatown, and the Spring Street shopping district. Stress-free weekend in the city with no regrets and fond memories. We look forward to a repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, clean and new! Every staff member we spoke to was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad?”
Reviews.Author: foodshooter
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here on business Jan 2012 and although not disappointed in any way I didn't really feel anything really justifies giving it a better rating. For a start the hotel is perfectly clean and everything seems and feels new. What I felt the hotel really lacked was character. It seemed like some of the main details had been overlooked when designing it. I had what I thought booked a 'King Suite', but as the price was very reasonable I didn't really seek to question the oversize double room. Sure it had a small dining table and a pull out couch, but wasn't a suite, nor did it have any storage or hanging for clothes, so I literally spent the entire 4 days living out of my suitcase. Not exactly a major problem, but more of an oversight by the management. The hot water went out one morning. I called guest services and was advised that it was being repaired and would be back on in 20 minutes. sure enough it was on in 20 minutes and again more of an inconvenience than a disaster, but not what I'd expect from a Sheraton. The coffee shop was always empty which meant ordering was quick. The bar area seemed quite adequete for a quick drink and nothing more. The location is about 1-2 blocks from Chinatown which makes for an entertaining diversion and some excellent and cheap food. Overall, despite my review I would stay here again as the price I managed to get for the room was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Downtown Find”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRetired
Reviews.Content: This is truly a great location and a gem of a hotel. This hotel will meet all your expectations. The service is fine. The rooms are fine. There are minor glitches like running out of umbrellas. Hey!I It's NYC, You can always pick up one on the street for a few bucks. I don't know what the bad review people were expecting, but this is a superior NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, functional, comfortable ... a great steal if you catch their $109/night deal”
Reviews.Author: nguyenntvu
Reviews.Content: i cannot remember the last time i paid this price for a hotel room in NYC area. Maybe right after 9/11 with a 50% off from priceline? so I was a bit skeptical about this hotel but it turned out to be a pleasant surprise. It is not exactly in a touristy location but A,C,E and 4,5,6 metro stations are within 5min walking distance, so just a hop away. The lobby, elevator, and hallways are clean and well maintained. As a Platinum SPG I was upgraded to a balcony room on the 2nd floor. The room was rather small, just enough for a king bed and a work station along the wall, but this is NYC after all. It was at least very clean - comfortable bed and decent sized shower. The private balcony, though almost as big as the room itself, only provided view of another building but could be a nice spot for a glass of wine at night. I believe only 2nd floor has some rooms with private balcony. The SPG lounge on the 21st floor has a nice view of the hudson river. Morning breakfast at the lounge was a bit ho-hum but I did not expect more for a Sheraton in the US. Overall it was a bit better than average and at $109/night a very good deal! The only major complain I have is the sound proof quality of the room, or at least in my room. I could hear everything coming from the next door. Unfortunately the guests went to bed early, otherwise I would have to call the front desk to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Go-to Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JJFigs
Reviews.Content: As far as NYC hotels go, this one is at the top of my list. I've stayed at many NYC hotels where the rooms are cramped, the hotels are old and in many cases outdated and you pay through the roof. HOWEVER, this Sheraton is unlike all the other NYC hotels I've stayed at. The reason...it's brand new! This Sheraton was built from the ground up just a couple of years ago, so everything is still new and fresh. The Rooms: The suites are very spacious and the regular rooms while a little cramped (like most NYC hotels) they are very clean, crisp and modern. The Staff: The front desk staff is excellent. Very helpful and knowledgeable. However, the concierge gentleman that I dealt with was not very helpful. He seemed like he couldn't be bothered. The Location: Not ideal if you have business in mid-town, but, it is very close to the subway (multiple lines) that can get you to mid-town fairly quickly. I love this location b/c I love Tribeca. There are some great restaurants in this location and boutique shopping. Tribeca for me at least, is also more manageable and easy. Overall, good property, great value and my go-to hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location Rules, Service Struggles”
Reviews.Author: JoMarch
Reviews.Content: Can't beat Tribeca location. This is absolutely dead average. The room quality is a little inconsistent but by and large you won't' make a huge mistake staying here, unless you are paying over $300/night. In that case you can definitely do better elsewhere. It's basically clean, the bed is comfortable. The food in the club room is Jenos party tray style so if you like that you're fine. Room service food also tastes frozen, so if you are a foodie, there are better hotels in the same price range. There are some very good folks on the Bell staff and a few good people at the front desk and that's what lifts this poor to average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little room”
Reviews.Author: msabrina531
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here 2 Fridays ago because I did not want to take the subway home late at night. Room was very small, but very fresh and clean. Nice bathroom amenities. My partner and I used the room strictly to get some rest. We did not use any of the hotel amenities. In my opinion, this is a 3 to 3.5 star hotel, not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Really comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: patmart
Reviews.Content: I booked the Deluxe King Room with Club Access for 5 nights. It was on the 20th floor, with an ok view to the skyline and a glimpse of the Hudson river. The room was not big for a Deluxe king, but there was a bergère, a working desk, a tiny closet and a reasonable size bathroom with a glassed doors shower (which for me is a plus, 'cause I hate those tub/shower curtain bathrooms that are only good to colect mold). The up side of every Sheraton Hotel is the bed, 'cause it really makes you feel like you're sleeping in the clouds. Breakfast was no biggy, but it was not much different from the buffet breakfast the hotel offers downstairs as well. Club Lounge didn't offer much too, but it's good to have an option after all.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel28120527
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6, teenage and young adult children, stayed at the hotel for 5 nights over the xmas break. I would happily recommend this hotel. The location is fantastic. Close to the subway and the "real" New York. We were on the club floor and had fantastic views and a complimentory breakfast every morning. Our rooms were on the upper levels and had great city views. The rooms were clean and the beds really comfortable.The concierge was very helpful and the ground floor bar was a great place to people watch and had a great vibe. The only drawback I can think of was the lifts, really really slow. Whilst I would probably not stay here I it were my husband and I, opting fro something a little more upmarket, for the six of us it was great value for money. Everything you needed and all the things you dont really need. For example the fit out is quite tired and I mentioned the lift.

Reviews.Title: “This place just can't get it right!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vivaladiva1
Reviews.Content: I have tried my best not to write a bad review on this hotel......but I have to be honest. If you look at my other reviews, I have NEVER given a hotel only 1 star! I have stayed at this hotel 2 times and tried to stay a third time about a month ago because of the price. My first time I stayed at this hotel it was the first week they opened. My room was clean (I was probably the first person to ever stay in it. Check in took over 20 minutes! The bathrooms are cute and my room was a nice size and I had a decent view. The staff was nice, but there were a lot of different little issues. I chalked it up to it being the first week and that the hotel would get better with time. The Platinum lounge is one of the nicest with a rooftop deck and great view. I liked the location because I work downtown often and at that time I was working in Brooklyn a lot which the train to BK was a block away. The second time I stayed was for about 2 months later with friends. They upgraded me to a "suite", which isn't a suite. Its a room with a couch and dining table. The room is still small just more furniture. Our check in was again over 20 minutes. The staff seemed confused, but friendly. The weekend was a mess. With keys that weren't working all weekend, construction going on that woke us up at 8am and was making our bed vibrating our bed. We were told there was construction still going on, but I love how that information wasn't told to us before we checked in. I feel like if there is noise going on that loud, maybe you should tell us so we can make a descion of not checking in. After cursing out the manager, he gave me points for the headache, but I swore I would never be returning again. Checking out took us almost 30 minutes. We almost missed our train to go home because of their "computer" delay. Around the holidays I had a friend from out of the country in town. I booked this hotel again because the rooms were only $99 per night and were in the area we needed to be in. A year had passed and I was hoping the hotel had got their $h*t together. Well, I was wrong. I am a SPG Platinum member and have been for years, but this hotel doesn't care. My card didn't go through because there was other hotel holds still on it from stays I had from earlier in the week. I told them I would pay cash (which I and my friend had a lot of) and I would leave cash or card deposit. Well, well, well they told me they can't do that. Excuse me? I have cash to give you as a deposit for incidentals. Remind you that I have over 50 stays a year, the rooms have mini bars and the front desk has the power to lock my movie rentals and phone. Still a no go. The manager said we have people who trash the room a lot. Really? I don't walk around thinking I deserve special treatment, but the entire point of being a elite member to something is for the "special treatment". I show my loyalty to a brand then I want the same loyalty back. Especially when your standing there with your bags during the holidays and just want to get into your room to relax and enjoy the little time your in town. My friend swiped his European card which it was denied as well and he didn't know why. I asked the hotel if it was their computer and they said no. Well, after an hour of what I like to call a big ol mess we ended up at the Le Meridan (which was only $60 more) and the manager said "because I'm a platinum member and stayed here before" he would take a cash deposit. My friend said could you try my card first, and they did.......which of course it went right through!!!! So there was no need for the cash deposit, but its nice to know that we could of used if we needed to. My friend loved the hotel so much that he booked the hotel for his conference in the spring time. This hotel isn't worth the headache. I never thought I would give a hotel one star especially a SPG hotel. I'm done completely.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy,Dark and Disappointing in Gotham”
Reviews.Author: gogobellatravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Canal St.So if you pick this Sheraton try to avoid walking east.Especially if you have kids and hang on to your purse!.If you choose this hotel be forewarned.I am an ex New Yorker and it's harassment from the bag sellers of bad fakes that is upsetting on Canal st.There are better hotels for more money across the street and slightly west.I think it would have been worth the extra dollars.The two positives of this location 1)a 15/20 minute walk southwest to 911 Memorial 2)Very close (north) to Soho and great shopping and eats.I am an SPG member and I was surprised at how they could care less.This is New York so I expected a smalI room(it was teensy)I asked for a luggage rack because I did not want to put my luggage on the bed.The closet was tiny and so dark! After two requests,I gave up.I never heard anything back not even a sorry we have no more.Nada.So I moved a shelf from under the desk to set my luggage on that.The bathroom you have to turn on a light because it's pitch black.Well with the light comes this horrible fan noise.There is another light that is not connected to the fan and it is in the shower.This light however does not give you enough light to put makeup on.So here I go moving furniture and now a lamp from the dark room into the dark bathroom so I can get ready in the morning.Sounds relaxing doesn't it? You can hear the people next to you so if you watch T.V. at night the sound has to be practically mute.Also the T.V. is fixed to the wall and it will not move at all so you cannot turn it in your direction.The thing that really was the most irritating is that you have an elevator key that you have to have each time you get in if you want your floor and if you forget your key well it's back down to the lobby to get a new one.When you check in they ask if you want your family members name on the record ,so,if your family member forgets the key your family member gets another.Well, so much for that. My family member was grilled when they went to get another key and they left the phone in the room and could not call me when I was in the club lounge to explain to me what happened. If there are alot of people in the elevator,each person has to pull out there key for there floor and it was hair-raising to try to get all the keys in and your button pressed before it passed your floor!This shows me that this is a sketchy neighborhood or they would not have this crazy key system.The Club Lounge is quite nice but this is extra $$.They have no heat lamps or anything cheery(even a fake flower would have been an improvement) out on the terrace.If you go outside on the terrace Club Lounge and take in the only reason to really stay here (the view of the Empire State building)You have to stand literally because the way they designed it if you sit down you stare at the wall.Not relaxing.At least there is a good pizza place around the corner Saluggi(sp?) I think. I suppose if you are on a higher floor and have a view of the Empire State Building and they did not make you pay for wi-fi per day, I might have enjoyed my two nights here.At least you could open your drapes and see your clothes to get dressed without having anyone look at you in your birthday suit from the building next door.On a positive note,great bedding one more negative beds are like xtra large twins.they do not seem to be even full/dble beds.The housecleaning lady left me a welcoming note in hopes of a gratuity I guess? When I went to check out I found that there was a charge of 2 five dollar waters.I think housecleaning must be responsible for telling the front desk this?I would have gladly given her the price of water before I would have drunk a bottle of water that was 5 bucks!The water was sitting there the whole time with the 5 dollar price on it.Then I had to spend time on reversing the charges.This was the nail in the coffin to a disappointing stay

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing experience, not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Harry833
Reviews.Content: Only the service at the hotel met our expectations. It was expensive considered what you could get for the money in the area, bad value for money, noisy, and the basic standard and cleanliness of the room was not 4* quality. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Juicy8914
Reviews.Content: We’ve stayed at several different Sheraton during this trip, yet Tribeca Sheraton is the BEST. Let’s start with the location; their location is a bit awkward. On Canal St. which has bad traffic most of time. Taxi drivers are avoiding coming to this area. However, it’s conveniently located close to China Town, SOHO, and Little Italy within walking distance. 2 blocks from subway station. The service is outstanding. You can feel the staffs are well trained at the second when you walk in. We were greeting immediately from bell desk, front desk and room service staffs. Although the room is a bit small, but it has everything you’ll need including safety box in the closet. The surprise chocolate on our bed and a hand write note to wish us happy New Year totally melt our hearts. Hubby said he will definite stay here again if we are visiting New York. P.S. Provide complimentary 40mins WiFi at lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good”
Reviews.Author: mmppwwzz
Reviews.Content: Canal St is a strange anachronism. Squabbling street vendors haggle over fake handbags and watches while the real thing is being sold only feet away in the uber-chic boutiques that characterize current day Tribeca. But this is the fun thing about Manhattan - all the contrasts that make the city full of such surprises. And right in the middle of all this sits the Sheraton Tribeca which was a very pleasant surprise. It's definitely a struggle to find a NY hotel with a rate that's even close to sensible, so cost often trumps quality. I took a deep breath and crossed my fingers when I found a great rate at this hotel. And what I found was a wonderful surprise. The hotel is completely up to date, and while the rooms are small (but which rooms aren't small in NY?) they have the usual features that one expects. My room even had the added bonus of a wonderful view looking north towards midtown with the Empire State and other landmark buildings brilliantly lit up at night. OK, so walking out onto Canal St can jolt anyone out of even the worst jet lag but all the fun streets like Mercer and Green St's in Tribeca and local cafe's, restaurants, wine bars, boutiques and people watching more than compensate for being hustled to buy some cheesy T Shirt on Canal St. Definitely worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “beat expectations”
Reviews.Author: mom2rk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru priceline with the biddng process. We got a good deal but didn't expect much after looking at the pics on tripadvisor. The checkin process was smooth and we got a room on the 2nd floor with a terrace. This is MLK weekend with temp in the teens so we did't use the terrace but it made the room seem bigger. The large sliding doors made the room seem bigger with the extension to the patio. The room was a decent size with 2 doublebeds. The room looked much better than the pics. We were all pleasantly surprised. Bathroom seemed new and modern. It's a good location if you like Chinatown/Little Italy. I can't imagin staying here for a week as a first time nyc tourist. Canal and West Broadway is not exactly a tourist hotspot and it's rather dark and deserted at night. We live in NJ so just stayed one night after dinner with friends. The location is okay if you are familiar with nyc and here for a short stay. The location is a few blocks from the Holland Tunnel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Rayrachz
Reviews.Content: I loved the location!!! I liked being in walking distance to soho and the west village! Also the E train station is right across the street that will take you to JFK! I thought the room was very nice!! It was small but that is what you get in NYC! I liked that there was a loofah in the shower with shower gel!! Nice treat! I will defiantly go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in Tribeca!”
Reviews.Author: J D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days to celebrate New Year and this hotel is a gem in Tribeca. Thanks to the efficient Mr. Tom Keane for his gracious accommodation given to our family. Also to Zakia David, and Javit (?) sorry if the spelling was wrong. We're glad we booked here instead of the crazy Times Square Hotels. The hotel has all the amenities we need, superb staff service from doormen to the front desk to the lounge staff. People here are friendly and so helpful. Soho has countless shops on sale and the Greenwich Village has good collection of reasonably priced CDs. Other famous landmarks are accessible. The view from the lounge balcony is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Temsumbum
Reviews.Content: Had no idea how fabulous this location is! Everything is in walking distant, even on a cold winter day! Tons of great restaurants and bars nearby. Was here for a wedding and the hotel staff was extremely accommodating and the price was great for the TriBeCa area. Great for all people!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Quality, No Complaints for a 1 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Grijns
Reviews.Content: Used it as a crash pad after a night out with my best friend. Good quality, room was on the small side, but I paid a very competitive price, it was like new, very clean, very easy check-in and check-out, so I was pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with reasonable rates (for New York) and within walking distance (about one mile) to Wall St. and 9/11 Memorial. The hotel is new, so the rooms are relatively large, clean and modern. Platinum members get access to the club lounge which has a good breakfast and fair hors dourves. The location is nice too - with lots of souvenir shops/vendors. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: they bite”
Reviews.Author: MartySF
Reviews.Content: I had a family crisis and needed to cancel our Christmastime trip the evening before it was to start. I called Sheraton central, was told it was less than 24 hours before arrival so they couldn't give a refund, but in the morning I should call the hotel directly. So I did -- NO HELP WHATSOEVER. No, they couldn't refund me anything at all. No, they couldn't apply it to a future stay instead. I spent my $300 and lost it. I know I was looking for an exception to a rule I'd agreed to up-front... but not even credit towards a future stay? If their argument is that they couldn't give the room to someone else that night, it's true, but that only means they lost their profit -- they didn't have to provide any service, make any beds, leave any shampoo bottles. I wasn't even refunded the high NYC taxes on the stay we didn't have. It seems telling that the person who "handled" my situation (i.e. blew it off) was the "Director of Revenue", not somebody focusing on customer satisfaction. Call me 0% satisfied. When we finally take that postponed NYC trip in a couple more weeks, why on earth would I choose the Sheraton? The chain has lost my business forever over one day's inflexibility.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnight Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lore G
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a Friday night here with my boyfriend for a quick getaway. The hotel is what you expect from a Sheraton which is clean with a friendly staff. The beds are extremely comfortable. I paid a little more for a city view but it wasn't worth it. Parking is $55.00, so I opted to park on the street for free. If you are staying on the weekend you can pretty much park after 6:00pm or 7:00 pm for free. Our keys didn't work for our room when we got in at 2:00 am. It took awhile for someone from the front desk to get up to our room to let us in. I liked that there was 45 minutes of free internet acces since most hotels charge for this. The location of the hotel is the very tip of Tribeca and therefore, very close to SoHo. It is a good location for someoen looking to walk and exlpore the city. Overall descent stay. I like that you are given 45 minutes of free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Tribeca- Off the Beaten Path Superb”
Reviews.Author: arpanic3
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Tribeca was referred to us by a former New York resident. It was exactly as described. Peaceful hotel on Canal Street without all the hustle and bustle of Times Square etc. Multiple subway stops convenient and accessible. The hotel is very friendly, very professional. The rooms are smaller but this is NYC. An excellent buy in our opinion. We will stay here again for sure! 24 hour bagel/deli shop next door had some of best sandwhiches in town! Bed was comfortable, be sure to spend the extra $$$ for the skyline view as it's beautiful to look out any time of day!

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvment”
Reviews.Author: Tord E
Reviews.Content: Our room had a very comfortable bed. But the room was too small for comfort. Why to they insist on sticking large, bulky armchairs into a room the size of a closet? There are sleaker solutions available. Our room had no safe! But a room safe was actually installed in our closet on our second day, after we pointed out the fault! It was difficult to get a good heat setting for the room. This may have been because of the cold outside but it was still a problem. The largest towels in the room were NOT bath towels. Yet another a dinosaur hotel charging for internet access. Should be FREE in 2012 (or at least for Starwood members). Free internet only available in the lobby but the access speed was terrible. Some "borrowed" our morning paper from outside the door - which we pointed out with no apologies from the management.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfortable base camp for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: idle_industriousness
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in a small room at the back of the hotel facing Lispenard Street -- very quiet, cozy, comfortable room with the typical high quality bed, sheets, amenities, etc. of a new Sheraton. The really wonderful, and unexpected, part of this hotel is the incredible views of midtown to the north and over to the Hudson to the west. The lounge on the club floor is terrific, excellent breakfast offerings, with a large outdoor terrace that allows unobstructed panoramic views of the city. Front desk and club lounge staff are friendly and cheerful. The location on Canal Street is not your typical tourist location, but it is great for exploring Soho (just cross Canal St and head north on West Broadway and go two blocks -- you're in the Soho shopping area) and Tribeca (again just turn south on West Broadway from the hotel and you're there) on foot. Lots of great bistros and little bars within 4-5 blocks. You can also get anywhere from here fast. Don't bother with a cab -- you're within two blocks of the subway stops for the A,C,E (turn left out the front door, then left on West Broadway), the 1,2 (turn left out the front door, cross Canal and walk west two blocks), and the N,R (turn right out the front door and walk east two blocks on Canal). Canal Street is not especially glamorous, but even with all the street vendors it is still less crowded and easier to walk through than Times Square. If it bothers you, turn off and walk along the side streets -- you'll see even more of the city!

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: foothillads
Reviews.Content: So I booked 2 nights at the Sheraton Tribeca with my daughter, an NYU student. I booked through hotels.com for a refundable rate in January-not a busy month, right? I cancelled the reservation 8 days before arrival, plenty of time! But the Sheraton has a 'small print' cancellation policy of charging one night for cancellations, no matter how far ahead. Then I looked at the reservation and they were charging $239 for the first night and $175 for the second night. That way, in the event of cancellation, they could keep the higher rate. Clever. In any case, I called Five Star services at hotels.com and they called the Sheraton. Sheraton held fast-no refunds, sorry. So Five Star actually credited me the difference for a nearly full refund because I stay in hotels 5 nights each month and am a good customer. I WILL NEVER BOOK A ROOM AT A SHERATON. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE. By the way, I cancelled due to medical reasons...!

Reviews.Title: “Great mini-vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bklynseltzer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here midweek, 2 days before New Year's Eve in NYC - when all other hotels were at least $100 more per night. The room was not large but totally perfect for our needs and it was clean and modern. The bathroom was great too, in fact, I now want to get one of those maginfying mirrors they have. The location is convenient to several subway lines and about a 20 minute walk to West Village or to dowtown/Financial District. And of course, if you want to experience an authentic Chinese, Vietnamese, Malasyian, or Thai meal, this is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Sheraton, location not the best”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteBT
Reviews.Content: Attracted to the hotel due to the reviews, location, price and name Sheraton. However this did not live up to Sheraton expectations. When I checked in the room I requested was not available so I was moved to a room for the physically challenged which had no bath. Whilst it is claimed this is right in trendy Tribeca, it is not in the nice part of Tribeca, the hotel is right on canal street and right in the middle of the area where people hustling and harrassing you trying to sell you fake louis vuittons from garbage bags. Also full of tacky souvenier and electronic shops, whilst I felt safe I would not stay here with children. The concierge was helpful however now on reflection and after reading some reviews post event, I think the concierge actually over charges, eg my ticket to warhorse $139 + the same again as a 'brokers fee'. If you are travelling at a quiet time of day take the subway or a normal NYC cab to the airport the hotel cab is a rip off at + $100. Internet charge was $9.95 per day, yet when I checked out I had been charged multiple times multiple days. No mini bar and room service till only 11pm, I expected more from a sheraton. On the plus side, on site starbucks and possibly the most comfortable bed I have slept in. World Trade Centre is only a 20 minute walk, Times Square, Central Park in good traffic 15 mins in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: trip4mom
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend with my mom and daughter (10) in this city hotel. Was all I would expect from a sheraton. Clean bathrooms, comfortable beds, and a good sized room. In this hotel you get a good value for your money. NYC hotel rooms tend to be very small, unless you spend a fortune. Breakfast as ok, nothing fancy. Staff was friendly and helpful. There is a subway close by, so it was a good hotel to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tomclubireland
Reviews.Content: We always stay in Midtown, but tried Tribeca this trip and loved it! The hotel is no frills, but has all that you need. Our room was fine. If you are a Starwood member, they have a great deck attached to the club room that they don't use, but you can go out and look at the great view. The lobby bar works, and there are so many great restaurants in the neighborhood! Parking is really expensive, but that is the price you pay to drive in Manhattan. There is a subway stop around the corner, too, and from here you can walk to everything from China town, Bloomingdale's, Ground Zero, the High Park, and Tribeca. And, our dogs were welcomed there!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money, great location and very friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pantofel
Reviews.Content: We booked 9 days in December 2011 over Christmas and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel. A block away from Soho meant we had the best stores and restaurants in Manhattan within walking distance. Hotel is very warm, inviting and a welcome respite from a cold New York winters day.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfhbryon
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, they did a great job of designing the hotel on a narrow lot right on Canal Street. Rooms while small (this is NY), are so well layer out they feel larger. I had a king bed and there was lots of space. Full size bath with shower added to feeling roomier. Staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that they have three small elevators to accommodate 22 floors, I can not remember the last time I continually had to wait for an elevator. Clean room, comfortable space, convenient location and reasonable price make this a winner. I did only give it three stars as for all the positives, it is just a basic hotel. I am surprised it is a Sheraton and not a Four Points.

Reviews.Title: “Seraton Tribeca, NY”
Reviews.Author: ewall02
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. I was a little nervous by the surroundings when I pulled up in the cab, but the inside was nice and seemed newly refinished. Check in and out was very easy, and the bed was very comfortable. I didn't try the bar or restaurant but the deli next door makes a great sandwich. Easy walk to shopping and multiple subway stops. Only issue was the half used shampoo left in the shower, yuck, and the fan was very loud and always on when the bathroom lights were on. Besides that it was very clean and perfect for a short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GradRecJo
Reviews.Content: This particular Sheraton, by New York standards, is very basic. It has everything you would expect from a Sheraton - clean, comfortable and good service, but it lacks some of the nice touches of other Sheraton's I have stayed at. I was there for business and for this purpose it was great. Good fast internet connection and a spacious desk and comfortable bed. Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment with a limited buffet selection but it was more than adequate. If you want to stay in the heart of New York and reliable comfort then this is a great choice. Canal Street can be bit dodgy at times but you're never far away from the action.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, it was a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: koozy21
Reviews.Content: Im from south carolina and I stayed here for 4 days recently, and it is not in the best location in the city, its a bit far from times square and other attractions, but the hotel was nice, the front desk was helpful and tony, the concierge had great restaurant suggestions and tours for me and my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Reactor1966
Reviews.Content: I needed a one night place to crash on the night of my company Christmas party. I chose this hotel primarily because of the proximity to the party, with the primary criteria being a clean bed and an inexpensive rate. I didn't expect much more of the Sheraton, especially given that I found a really low rate for a weekend night in NYC. I was quite pleasantly surprised with what we found. For starters, the lobby looks like it was redone recently - very clean and kind of funky interior. Check in was super fast and friendly. There is a business center in the middle of the lobby with internet access and newspapers. Off to the side is a bar, and to the back is a Starbucks. The room is about the size I would expect (ie: small), but it was really well designed and this too looked like it was renovated not long ago. Bathroom has a huge shower. Bed was very comfy with 4 giant pillows. The in-room safe is probably large enough for a laptop, which is unusual. Besides my location preference, this is right on the edge of Chinatown, Little Italy and Tribeca. There is parking around the corner, but like most NYC parking it's expensive (about $50 a day). I'd return to this hotel again, whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not the greatest Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: beautytravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the hotel is almost brand new and in a great location right between Soho and Tribeca. On the other hand, the 'deluxe' room was very small, with no storage / wardrobe to speak of, no mini bar, expensive wifi, the smallest bathroom with strange folding doors and an extremely noisy ventilator (we're talking hurricane strength), in top of the imcredible noise from the street (despite the higher floor). Staff efficiency and friendliness was mixed, the room wasn't made one day until we enquired. I know New York isn't famous for its warm hospitality but given you always seem to spend a small fortune in hotels (once the 6 different sales, room and local taxes have been added), this left room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “New York Idyll”
Reviews.Author: EnglandComfortseeker
Reviews.Content: Lovely new hotel, staff really friendly, welcoming and helpful. Room with lovely big comfortable bed and in room safe etc (no fridge). Had the best stay i have ever had in NY, Tribeca is a great area with brilliant restaurants, cafes, bars and away from the oppressive crowds of Times Square etc - great to see but not to stay in (having done this before!). 15 mins walk to ground zero. 20 mins walk to Union Square. JUST BRILLIANT!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg R
Reviews.Content: Nice and dimly lit hotel with open air plan. Rooms are comfortable enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: LeoTheo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work at 250/nt. I was pleasantly surprised to find a hopping lobby full of fashionable people, a nice bar, nicer brightly lit space with what looked like a nice restaurant attached, the front desk person was friendly, the room had everything needed for an overnight stay. A one cup coffeemaker, a blow dryer, flat screen TV and plenty of easily accessible plugs for electronics. Good desk space, comfy clean bed with good pillows, climate control that's easy to use, panoramic view from floor 19, iPod radio. The bathroom products were not high end but for the price that's ok. Would stay here again. Why pay more?

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ayano.coco
Reviews.Content: great location, very clean room, large and comfortable bed. Thanks to the manager Lowell, we really enjoyed our 5 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “I was SO surprised! I WILL return!”
Reviews.Author: shooflyfarm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary. We normally stay at very high class hotels but that night we wanted to try something new without spending a fortune. (St. Regis, Ritz, etc are our norms) We wanted the Tribeca area so we pulled up to the hotel (unassuming front) The Bell guys were so nice and took care of our bags right away. While checking in we had at least 3 people come up to us and say Happy Anniversary. Being Starwood platinum, we had it all set up to hopefully get an upgrade. We gave 12,000 points which was the minimum. They told us we could not have a suite and we were a little disappointed but it would be fine because he was giving us a great view. Then the manager came in and changed everything and gave us the nicest suite ever! They gave us the top floor. They brought champagne and chocolate strawberries quickly to our room. It was the best ever!! The room was simple but beautiful. The view was amazing! The bed was soooo comfortable and I slept like a baby. I can't say enough about the bathroom. It was sooo nice. I would give the bathroom a 5 star. I'm not kidding! For a sheraton, it was very impressive. I don't know why I haven't been to this hotel before. Now that I know how nice everyone is there and how extremely comfortable they made us, I will go back soon. We go into the city a lot and I will for sure go back!! Thank you so much Sheraton! You wowed us!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price but not four star”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: Good price for the room. But it's not four star. Three at a push. But makes up for it because it's cheap. Bad point: music too loud in lobby. Good point: great king size bed

Reviews.Title: “Very glad we decided to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: homersmee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a little while back and were very pleased with the location, the staff and the accommodations. We decided to upgrade our room to one of the higher floors and thought it was worth it for the views of the Empire State building and the city skyline. There were some adverse conditions (hurricane / tropical storm) during our stay and the hotel staff did an outstanding job making sure we were taken care of and safe. The general Manager, Lowell, really took charge and seemed to still be enjoying himself during the entire ordeal. Little Italy and China town are both within walking distance. We also made our way down to the financial district, stopping to see the city hall and other sites along the way. Subway stops are only a block away and we found that if you walked over a block to either 6th Avenue or Broadway you could easily waive down a taxi. I had a sandwich (The Spiderman) from the Tribeca Deli next door to the hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The world famous Lombardi's pizza is also only a few blocks away in Little Italy and is worth a visit if you have never been. Up on Prince street is Torrisi Italian Specialties. We stopped to eat here twice as it was easily one of the best restaurants (albeit smallest) in Manhattan. Overall we found the hotel covered all of our basic needs and exceeded them in many regards. We have recommended this place to friends visiting New York city in the future and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!!”
Reviews.Author: Maryann S
Reviews.Content: First overnight stay in NYC and I don't think it could've been better for the location and price. Hotel is extremely clean, and new with modern decor. Hotel staff was extremely helpful and professional. We stayed in a room on the 20th floor with an amazing view of the Empire State building. From here, you could also see all the chic new condos/apts in Tribeca with their rooftop patios and lush gardens. It was really beautiful. The room was small, which is to be expected in NYC so I don't see a need to complain about it, I knew what I was getting when I booked it. Bathroom was very nice and shower was great. Once leaving the hotel, you are directly on canal street so expect it to be loud and busy.
