There are some really great restuarants within walking distance and I suggest walking around to see Tribeca a little bit while you are there. Bubby's is a great brunch spot and it's only a 10 minute walk!

Reviews.Title: “You've gotta love it, for the staff if nothing else!”
Reviews.Author: Shelby775
Reviews.Content: During my week at the Sheraton TriBeCa, the staff were always amazing, from the chatty coffee shop servers, to the lovely front desk associates and the daily notes from Jane in housekeeping. But for me the quality of the hotel comes down to the doormen and how they treat the guests. All hail Michael V, one of the doormen at the Sheraton. This man became my Prince Charming when one horribly windy and rainy day I got my stiletto heel stuck in the outside grate. He ran to assist, helped me balance on one foot while he tried to free the offending shoe! On his knees in the wet, calling for tools to leverage the blasted thing as he didn't want to break the heel from the shoe. What a star, he got it free, only a little worse for wear! So thank you, thank you, thank you to my Prince Charming!

Reviews.Title: “Nice find in the downtown manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Kevin G
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in Tribeca. It is not close to Uptown, theatre district or shopping - but you can hop on the subway and be uptown in minutes. I hate to tell "travelingfool" that no hotels in NYC or any resort for that matter have free internet. This hotel has an outstanding computer area which you can use for free and the lobby is wired for internet for free. Thanks to everyone who was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Mr”
Reviews.Author: HarrisClarke
Reviews.Content: Our dry cleaning was lost for reasons unknown. I would like to congratulate Steve Lamour the front desk manager for the efficient way this matter was handled. Within 14 days of returning to England a full refund was credited to my Card. Well done

Reviews.Title: “No free in-room internet - Tacky for the room price!”
Reviews.Author: travelingfool1234
Reviews.Content: For the $300+/night price I paid for the room, they don't even include free in-room Internet. How tacky is that? Next time I will stay at one of their competitors' properties where breakfast is free and so is wireless Internet. Other that that, the room seemed particularly small, even for NYC standards. But it was clean and the bed was comfortable, so it gets the 2 circles I'm giving it because of those features. The USB charger in the wall did not work. Lastly, I asked the front desk agent about why my receipt showed I wasn't getting loyalty points. She declined to help and suggested I call the 800 #. Not very helpful. The bellman was very helpful though in getting our bags and hailing cabs. There is a nice little convenience store next door that offers cooked-to-order hot breakfast, pizza, and other hot food that is actually pretty tasty and much cheaper than the hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “good central location + views”
Reviews.Author: faunboy
Reviews.Content: Like many of the Sheraton/Starwood properties in NYC, this hotel has managed to capitalize on an excellent location. In addition to its address on Canal Street, one of the city's main arteries, within a couple of blocks of several different subway lines, this hotel is a very easy walk from all sorts of cool and interesting neighborhoods. If you should happen to decide that the restaurant in the hotel is too crowded or expensive (as I did), you are only a few minutes away from the much more interesting restaurants of SoHo, Chinatown, or TriBeCa. The hotel itself is pretty nice too - the lobby tends to be too crowded, but that's because it hosts the hotel's free WiFi, the Sheraton Link computers, a nice bar, AND a Starbucks. The desk staff is helpful and cosmopolitan, and there is also an on-site concierge. The rooms are fairly basic and a bit small, but clean and well appointed. If you can get a room on a higher floor, the views are great. The club lounge, although only available to club level guests or Platinum rewards guests, is clean and pleasant, and while the free breakfast for club guests isn't gourmet or particularly exciting, it is a) free and b) plentiful. It's also a lot better than the free continental breakfast many places offer (i.e. a packaged muffin or bagel and weird coffee). The club lounge also includes a rather spacious roof deck with completely amazing views - it faces north, but you can also look out over either the East River or the Hudson River.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Sheraton I've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: Mike_D_Ann_Arbor
Reviews.Content: This is a new Sheraton with a gleaming lobby and clean and new rooms. What sets this Sheraton apart is the friendly service from everyone. The front desk, the club floor hostess, and the doorman were all professional and courteous, which is saying something in NYC! The only other Starwood with service this consistent in NYC is Le Parker Meridien. The bill the Sheraton slipped under my door already had the internet charges removed (as they are for SPG platinums like me). Also, the breakfast is the best club room breakfast I've ever had. Lovely fresh fruit, scrambled eggs not dried out, sausage, bacon, tasty looking pastries, many different kinds of bagels and cereal, Starbucks coffee, Tazo tea, readily available skim milk, etc. The hostess (Zakira? She had a unique name) even procured ketchup for me when I asked, and apologized it wasn't already out ("I knew there was something I forgot," she said). Cons: In the boondocks, tacky room decor (does brick red ever look good used so liberally?), no views from most rooms, groaning bathroom fan. But the downsides are negligible, and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: remhed
Reviews.Content: This a newer Sheraton in a great location on Canal Street in Manhattan. You are walking distance from Tribeca, Soho, Little Italy, and Chinatown. You are also within a block or two of three subway lines so you can get anywhere pretty easily. The lobby area is nice and they have a bunch of stations set up for people to get on line. There is a bar but we did not visit it. The room was newer and clean, if a bit small (though probably standard by Manhattan standards). I would probably stay here again although I thought it was pricey for what is probably a 3 star hotel at best- but that's New York.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MsNic
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel. The rooms are a bit small but clean and comfortable. It sucks that the only complimentary wifi is in the lobby and you have to pay $10 to use it in your room. So, the wifi area in the lobby is always packed.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location, premium price”
Reviews.Author: Cameramens
Reviews.Content: As you would expect from Starwood Hotels, this is a fine hotel. It has a very friendly and helpfull staff and the location is perfect for business as well as pleasure. Soho and Chinatown are a short walk away and the subway lines A,C & E stop right around the corner to bring you to the rest of Manhattan. The only downside is that this part of Canal street is crawling with street vendors selling counterfeit Gucci and Prada. The rooms are luxureous; Good bed, large TV. We had no breakfast in the hotel because it appeared better and cheaper outside and it was very crowded in the morning. There is a little bar in the lobby where you get Starbucks coffee and a snack. But...: Internet is only free in the lobby (45 minutes a day), on your room it's $10/day. This should be free of charge. The rooms are reasonable quiet, but in this class of hotels you would expect better soundproofing - especially the doors. You can hear the doors slamming in the hallway all night and morning. And: All this does not come cheap, we paid around $380/night. With that in mind, the value is average.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: Warwick H
Reviews.Content: the real benefit of this hotel is the central location that makes it to run around to meetings - the service level is excellent - especially the doormen Michael V & Jarrett seemed to be there to help me with anything I needed every time i hit the footpath. All the other staff were fantastic but these became almost like new friends in manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KMAMA_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel recently for our 15th wedding anniversary. The staff was fantastic. They were friendly, helpful and very responsive. Overall the hotel was clean and the location was great - within walking distance to all the shopping on Canal and Broadway as well as many great restuarants and China town. The only negative is that it seemed a bit pricy for the area but in the end we felt it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly decent hotel given the Canal Street location. Don't miss the rooftop lounge area.”
Reviews.Author: PhilNTed
Reviews.Content: Very clean, pleasant and efficient. (Tribecca is a great neighborhood but Canal Street is gross.) Nice decor. Very comfy beds. If you're a light sleeper avoid the corner rooms because the doors open and close loudly. Free wi-fi in the lobby but not in the room. Great roof deck on the 18th floor but you have to ask to be let up unless you have a club key.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel acts like guests are stupid and not important.”
Reviews.Author: Montreal-2010
Reviews.Content: The front desk lies and says you "requested" one bed when you asked for two; the internet stinks & is virtually non-existent, so their "computer center" is a mean joke; the prices for rooms and even for breakfast are exorbitant; the advertising photos pretend that you'll get great views, but almost all rooms look onto brick walls; the owners regard guests as walking bags of money and they know they will get a lot of it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Yusra_M
Reviews.Content: Room was quite Spacious.. for NYC Standards, Clean & very Comfortable! Loved the Location.. walking distance to some of my favorite Boutiques in Soho!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abby2992
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip in September. I usually keep my business trips to New York City to one night because a comfortable hotel room of good quality is tough to come by at a decent price and in a convenient location. My stay at the Sheraton Tribeca was the first time I was wishing I was staying longer. The room was a good size for NYC with ample space at the writing desk and a comfortable armchair for watching tv. There is no closet, but a decent sized armoir for two people that fit everything I needed. The bathroom was wonderful - a great shower and nice finishes. The view was decent, with a little peak of the bridge, and getting to the subway to zip around the city was a short two block walk. I didn't try the restaurant, but the bar was decent. A great location for exploring Soho. I'm looking forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, great location, would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Monkeybike54
Reviews.Content: I took my two daughters to New York for a 4 day, 3 night shopping trip. The hotel was clean, the staff were always helpful, and the location is great. I was concerned after reading previous posts about the Canal Street location. There are other streets to go outside this hotel to avoid Canal, even though we were out until midnight and had no problems. Walking out the front of the hotel, you can walk straight down Wooster,( a really trendy art studio street) and turn at any of the cross streets, which are lined with cafe's, retail stores, etc. It's about a 15 minute walk from the hotel to Greenwich Village, on streets lined with restaurants, clothing stores, and the like. We had a great time, and would definitely stay there again. The only negative is having to pay $10 dollars a day to have Internet in your room, I think the Sheraton could do better

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel: Clean, new, great location”
Reviews.Author: crisnicole
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Tribeca is a clean, new, contemporary hotel near Soho. The location was convienient to travel easily in NYC. The subways are nearby. My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the hotel. We were stuck there during the hurricane and we were thankful we had a very nice new roomy comfortable king size bedroom, large flat screen tv with a terrific view of the Empire state building. There are computers available to use downstairs with free internet access. The lobby is very welcoming and the staff were very friendly and hospitable. I enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it. However, next time, I would stay near central park and the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: email_iandsmith
Reviews.Content: I wish there was a ranking between Average and very good as this hotel would definitely fall under this rating. The staff were mostly friendly and helpful and the location of the hotel is excellent. The room however was tiny. This may be standard for New York but $300 a night for a room that only just had enough room around the bed to walk around seems a little excessive. My biggest issue was the fact that there is no mini bar/fridge in the room. This was frustrating when bring back water or drinks to the room as we then had no where to keep them cold. On the positive side... there was always a computer available for the free internet service, it was only a short walk to SOHO, China Town, Little Italy and Greenwich Village. It is also literally a 3 min walk to the Canal sunway station which will take you directly to Time Square within 10-15 mins. The personal note from housekeeping each day was also a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “just ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: kcanavan2010
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely nice but the property is just regular and the cost seemed high to me (400 usd) the location is very good if you want to be in soho or tribeca and there are 2 metro stations very close. the hotel has an integrated starbucks making breakfast easy.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, if the price is right. Great bed.”
Reviews.Author: Tom2592
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Tribeca is a new, mid-scale Sheraton located on gritty (but safe) Canal Street (a highly-trafficked through street that runs between an East River bridge and the Holland Tunnel), but is literally around the corner from the best of SOHO and Tribeca. Its 4* rating is reflective of its full-service status, but one should not infer "near luxury", as might be associated with 4* Westin or Intercontinental. The decor is trendy and high-tech and oriented to a younger crowd. During our 4 day stay, we saw lots of young people and lots and lots of European tourists. The staff was excellent- efficient and eager to please. The hotel is new and everything works. Like all Starwood properties, the beds are wonderful. The buffet breakfast at $15 is a bargain. Given how noisy Canal Street is, it is a pleasant surprise that the rooms are as quiet as they are. Bottom line: The hotel does the job and is convenient to the downtown scene. It isn't luxurious, but isn't down-market either. At $350/400 a night, I can do better elsewhere. With a one or two in front of the price, you will have done well in Manhattan, especially if you want to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meaghan L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca two weekends ago. The room was great - updated, nice size (especially in New York). It was crowded because we had a stroller, crib and fridge, but probably bigger than some studios. I had arranged for a crib and a fridge since we were travelling with an infant. They provided a full sized crib, which is wonderful. Other hotels we have stayed at have dingy pack and plays. Everyone we encountered was wonderful and helpful. I couldn't have enjoyed our stay any more, it was a wonderful place for young families. The only down side for us was that the location wasn't wonderful. It was pretty much a hike to every where we wanted to be, but that was my mistake. Also, the business center was right in the lobby and it provided you with a half hour or so of free internet time. We only used about 2 minutes of it to print our boarding passes, but that was a fantastic set up. Pre kids, I travelled quite a bit and while I have stayed at swankier hotels, the Sheraton Tribeca is now definitely one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claxtonbocaraton
Reviews.Content: Had a great overnight. Club floor great - especially breakfast. In particular like to commend Michael the doorman. He is awesome!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, decent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MNHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend, from Wed-Mon. We booked through Priceline and got a really great rate as a combined air/hotel package. Our room was not ready when we arrived at around 11am, but we’d anticipated that, as check in isn’t until mid-afternoon. They happily stored our luggage for us and gave us an estimated time that a room would be ready. We went in search of lunch in the meantime and had a great meal in Chinatown. We wandered around, returning to the hotel at the estimated time. A room still wasn’t available, but the front desk clerk quickly made some calls and found a room that would be ready in 10-15 minutes. Enough time to grab a beer at the hotel bar! They had a special going on some bottles, so it was reasonably priced for us (I think $3 or $4?). The lobby was very nice - computers to use, a full bar, Starbucks, and you can use their Wi-Fi for free in the lobby (for 45 min at a time). They let us know when the room was ready and got our bags for us. The room was small, but not too small. We had a king-bed room on the 10th floor. As others have noted, there’s not a real closet, but they do have a wardrobe with some shelves to put your clothes and there are more shelves under the desk area. Only a shower, no tub, but that didn’t bother us as we don’t usually use hotel tubs anyway. The bed was extremely comfortable and the a/c worked great. The housekeepers our first 3 days or so were great. Left us notes thanking us for the tip we left and when I requested an extra towel, she responded and gave us extra everything! Much appreciated. The last couple of days we didn’t get any notes and the extra towels were gone w/o replacements. Oh well. Not a big deal, but the personal communications and accommodations were a nice touch. Canal St isn’t the most scenic or prettiest street in NYC. But you are within steps of Soho, Tribeca, Chinatown and Little Italy, not to mention a few different subway lines (and if you have a smart phone and are nervous about navigating the city, I highly recommend the HopStop app). I thought it was a great location to be stationed and we never felt unsafe – you have to use your room key to operate the (sometimes slow) elevators. I don’t know if I’d pay the full going rate for the Sheraton Tribeca – I’m pretty sure it would be out of our budget. But if I found another great deal, I would definitely give it another go.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler4432
Reviews.Content: After much searching my husband aand I decided on this h otel. We had reserved two rooms as two of our sons and one of our grandsons were meeting us in New York. The rooms were beautiful. Views were fantastic. Beds were quite comfy. Everyone we came in contact with was helpful, especially the gentleman who drove us to the train station, as there were five of us and that is too many for a taxi. Enjoyed the lounge area at night after walking and seeing the sights of New York City. The bartender was great! Canal Street is a little crazy but the location is perfect to get uptown or downtown. Highly recommend! We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “It's not your usual Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Shmol
Reviews.Content: I think for Sheraton standards this hotel is average, as it doesn't have a proper vehicle access or any sort of grounds for that matter. It doesn't have a swimming pool and its restaurant wasn't operating when we stayed there. Other than that, the hotel is conveniently located in the Tribeca suburb and is clean and pleasant inside. The room isn’t too big, but it’s an ok size for a couple and a bathroom is very beautiful with a very large walk-in shower room. The bed was very comfy and the sheets were spot on clean. Now because it’s Sheraton they do charge $5 for bottled water, which they put next to the coffee machine. Their housekeepers also expect tips, although they don’t always do the best job at toping up toiletries and coffee. There is no free internet in the room, but there is free Wi-Fi and a few computers in the lobby. We dined at the bar next to the lobby twice and both times ordered an Angus steak, which was unbelievably juicy and tender. Overall, this hotel was definitely a good find for us.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation problems, but great hotel otherwise”
Reviews.Author: ChristineAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I made 2 separate reservations for a 2 day stay, first for one day and then for a second, when it became clear that I needed to extend my stay. This led to all kinds of problems with my being locked out of my room, etc etc. The hotel seemed completely unable to combine the 2 reservations into one. The bed was fantastic, the views are great, and the staff was nice. Breakfast was average.

Reviews.Title: “So fine !”
Reviews.Author: Kaj S
Reviews.Content: Super nice new hotel. Perfect location for fashion-shopping and so many bars and restaurants to visit. Beautiful wiev from 9. floor room towards north (Empire State Building) and overlooking Soho rooftop-silouette. Deli next door, rent-a-bicycle across Canal Street and delicious breakfast downstairs in the hotels restaurant or in-house Starbucks. Staff - ALL of them - were top-dedicated to the goal of making our stay a dream come true. Clearly recommendable. I´ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in spite of Irene visting.”
Reviews.Author: poohkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca the last weekend of August, 2011 for a wedding. Irene, the hurricane, was not invited but she came anyway. We drove our car to the hotel and were a little surprised that there wasn't a better entrance for guests arriving. You're lucky to get a spot on Canal Street to unload your car. Valet parking was $60/day. Upon arrival, I thought we'd be bombarded by bellmen who'd help us get unloaded, etc. but not so much. My husband ended up taking our car to a local garage that was INDOORS and ABOVE GROUND to make sure we'd be okay if the hurricane hit. It ended up taking him about 20 minutes to go around the block and I attribute this to the mad rush of commuters getting out of the city before the storm him. Still, kind of a pain to deal with. Otherwise, check in was smooth. We were in the club level as our reservation was booked with my Starwood points. The bellman who took us our to our room, was extremely knowledgable, full of information, and eager to give us a great experience. We were taken to our room on the 17th floor. Our room was beautiful and roomy for NYC standards. One wall was all windows looking right towards the the Empire State building. Fantastic views and the rooms are brand new and well designed. Because of the impending hurricane, many of the guests were basically stuck at the hotel since all of Tribeca shut down. So the bars was full, the computers were being used and there was a lot of activity in the lobby and restaurant. I have to give the staff a ton of credit. No one seemed annoyed by the questions, the stress or the influx of guests. They kept a bulletin board with storm updates in the lobby and a flyer on each floor. Overall, the hotel was fantastic at providing news on the storm, what roads were open, what their plan was, and what we could expect if we got hit hard. Fortunately, we only lost cable for a an hour or two. Power never went out. And I have to mention how comfortable the beds were. We slept so well during the height of the storm and the linens kept us warm and cozy. Upon checkout, right after the storm, we decided to hit the breakfast buffet to get some food in us before our drive home. If we could actually drive anywhere. The buffet left a lot to be desired. The eggs were old and cold, there was no more toast left and none of the staff seemed concerned that they were busier than usual and guests were in line waiting to eat. However, I have to say that the Sheraton staff managed the storm and its inconveniences really well. I loved that there was a Starbucks in the lobby to get some morning coffee. And the lobby was bustling with travelers who made it a communal meeting space. The staff accomodated. The rooms are extremely comfortable, the views are amazing and the location is central to everything in lower Manhattan. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, incredible views, good value”
Reviews.Author: RickInPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over Labor Day weekend and was very pleased with it. As a devoted Starwood Preferred Guest, I'm pretty picky about my hotels. And this one definitely hit the mark. First off, it's just around the corner from the subway station that serves the A, C and E lines. That means if you flew into JFK, it drops you off almost at the front door for a whopping $7.25 with both the Air Train and Subway fares. Other subway lines are within a few blocks, so you can literally get anywhere in Manhattan very easily and for $2.25 a ride. Add to that, you're right across the street from SoHo, which has shopping and restaurants a-plenty - all very walkable. This is a busy hotel with a fairly small lobby area that made it feel even busier. But that was never an issue for me. I was still able to get an elevator rather easily. The lobby is modern and clean with lots of amenities - a grab-and-go food/drink counter, a small bar with seating area, a restaurant, and an area with several computers . I was lucky to get into a room on an upper floor, so the view was great. Furnishings are comfortable, including the bed. The bathroom isn't huge, but it's well-equipped with a nice stand-up shower and well-lit mirror. The one thing I thought was odd was there were no drawers for unpacking my suitcase. The closet had hangers, but nowhere to really put things that don't hang. Not a huge inconvenience. Staff was very friendly, efficient and helpful. The rooftop deck (which I believe is only accessible to Club floors - Splurge! It's worth it!) has INCREDIBLE 180 degree views of the city, as well as breakfast and evening snacks. This is highly unique for a New York hotel. Yes, so this hotel is directly on Canal Street, which is totally nasty and crowded. But as you walk out the front door, just head left and go around the corner to the parallel street behind Canal. It's quiet, safe, and no one is going to try to sell you a fake Rolex. That's what I did to get to the N, Q, R subway stop. And once you get off of Canal in any direction, your'e right back to charming, movie set-like, downtown New York. Comparing to what NYC hotels are charging these days for a nice, modern, new-ish room, I thought this hotel was a bargain - and I compare all Starwood properties before I make my decision (always check AAA rates and "hotel offers" on the SPG site before you book). This one has often had the lowest price. Request or book an upper floor, or at least one that faces uptown. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: chelseacat
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Tribeca is a newer hotel in downtown Manhattan. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. We were in a connecting room and could hear the neighbors children. Easy walk to Soho and the subway. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant customer service experience!!"”
Reviews.Author: mcg1121
Reviews.Content: Sorry--I am not accustomed to posting negative reviews but must share my terrible customer service experience at the Sheraton Tribeca as fair warning. This is a very nice property but if the hotel can get away with charging you for something, they will. I stayed here in April for a college visit to NYU with my daughter and booked another reservation on August 29 for her move in at NYU. Unfortunately, I had to cancel the reservation because NYU shifted move-in schedules due to Hurricane Irene and it would no longer be feasible for me to check in to the hotel on the same day as the rescheduled move-in day. I called the hotel directly to cancel the reservation. For some reason, the hotel staff member did not provide a cancellation number--perhaps distracted due to--I don't know--maybe a myriad of guest cancellations due to the hurricane? Moreover, for some very strange reason--perhaps with so much on my mind between rearranging all of my travel schedules, being emotional over my first-born going away to college, and feverishly shopping for dorm items online while the city was shut down--I did not ask for a cancellation number for the first time in my life. Not only did the hotel charge me for the room and not retain a record of the room cancellation (don't they record conversations in the event of disputes like this?), they also insist that if I did not receive a cancellation number, then 1) the responsibility is mine to ask for one, and 2) if they don't have a record of it, it did not happen. Really?! Is it not possible that perhaps one of the hotel staff members got distracted and neglected to give me a cancellation number and record this important information? I have the phone record to prove that I called the hotel in advance of my stay and–believe me, it was to cancel the room, not a request to fluff up my pillows! I had four phone conversations with the hotel to try to resolve this--first with Steven at the front desk, who promised I would receive a phone call from the general manager--a phone call I never received. When I called back, I spoke with Priscilla, she insisted she was "the manager" and insisted on resolving my problem, and then when I asked for the general manager, she instead referred me to Cornelio Encarnacio, the reservations manager. Fast-forward several days later, and a conversation with Cornelio that went nowhere. When I again asked to speak with the general manager, I was referred instead to the revenue manager. Um – me thinks the revenue manager would not be inclined to reverse charges if he is responsible for increasing revenue. Just a guess. Why were guarding the GM? It was not until I looked up the general manager's name online and asked for him by name that I finally spoke with GM Lowell Beebe-Center. Apparently, he had been spoon-feeding his staff the responses to me because he held the same position -- no record at the hotel means it did not happen. He refused to reverse the charge and assume any responsibility for the mistake his staff made. Lessons learned: 1) always ask for and record a cancellation number and, 2) apparently, the customer never wins at the Sheraton Tribeca. I have never encountered such unfriendly and unbending management and staff—especially in light of the circumstances. We were both affected by Hurricane Irene and the hotel took advantage of that. I guess they really, really needed the revenue. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but I was expecting more from this Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Dagger0815
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Tribeca is a tyical business hotel suited directly at Canal Street. The rooms are not too small, the furniture is nice and the bathroom was clean. So, the objective aspects are all right. But then again, you do not have normal glasses in your room. Plastic mugs are okay for a YMCA or some low budget hotel, but not for a Sheraton. Further, the rooms do neither have a deposit nor a mini bar, the shampoo wasextremly greedy portioned etc. Many minor details, but still, a Sheraton does not have to present itself like thtat.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel. Good for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: mpolatin
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a Plat for the first time last weekend with the wife. It is a 'fine' and basic hotel. I got the usual ''upgrade'' from a basic room to a club floor -- still dont really consider this an upgrade- but nevertheless. This hotel is in a great location for shopping. Next to Broadway and Soho -- some great places within walking distance...There is a club lounge which is very nice and has a great patio, BUT no free alcohol! Which basically renders this lounge useless except for a basic cold breakfast in the morning. What's the point? Might as well go to a nice bar...The rooms here are fine. Basic. Nothing fancy...Staff was friendly...Ultimately, good location for shopping -- and if you want to get away from Times SQ.

Reviews.Title: “we loved the service”
Reviews.Author: Linda E
Reviews.Content: Everyone was delightful, especially David Tom. He did everything with a smile. The beds and pillows were OUTSTANDING. We slept like babies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for this trip!”
Reviews.Author: clark67
Reviews.Content: We (I mostly) travel to NYC regularly, so we are quite independent there. Great place if you love downtown: SoHo, Tibeca, etc. Walked to Ground Zero. Hotel was busy! Totally set up for convenience (2 outlets in each bedside lamp, extra little shelves in the bathroom and right inside the guest room) and very helpful staff. Obviously recently remodeled and well-conceived. Used the front desk and Concierge rarely, but they were quite helpful. Great open multi-use area in the center of the lobby for computers and for drinks just over a partial wall. OH! Our room was out-of the way a bit, so VERY quiet. Great view of midtown!

Reviews.Title: “great stay cut short by Irene”
Reviews.Author: TJCOakville_Canada
Reviews.Content: Very clean & modern hotel. Staff were very friendly & helpful. No problem getting refund when we had to evacuate for Irene.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: AroundThaWorld
Reviews.Content: This was my 1st trip to NYC and I was not expecting to receive this level of friendliness from the Staff at Sheraton Tribecca. I arrived in the hotel at about 9AM from JFK and was praying that I was going to be able check-in early since I was not feeling very well. I was greeted by this very nice lady at the front desk (she was pregnant) and she was immediately aware of my condition. She checked her computer and gave me a room. The check-in process was very fast, probably 5 minutes (or less), which I was so grateful for since all I needed at that time was sleep. We only stayed there for 2 nights but during that time all the Staff we encountered were very friendly, informative & helpful. From the Concierge, the Bell Man, the Barista (at the coffee shop at the Lobby), to the Housekeeper. The hotel looks new & have modern ammenities. Room and bathroom were both very clean; I did not notice any stains on the carpet, the wall, and more importantly the bed spread. Everything was immaculate. It's on the small side, but what do you expect, it's NYC. And there is only 2 of us. 3 would be a crowd. The AC is a little on the loud side but it didn't bother us. Bed was very comfortable. The hotel is located on Canal Street which was always jammed packed. We avoid hailing cabs on that street and just took the subway which was only about 1 minute walk from the hotel. There wasn't much going on at nite on the Canal Street. It was around 11pm and we were looking for a bite to eat and so we walked a few blocks away (towards the Tribecca Grand Hotel) and found a few restaurants there and a night club. The restaurants did not serve food at that hour (I think we had just missed the last call) but the host was nice enough to send us over to the Lobby of the Tribecca Grand Hotel...they served great midnight snacks and we were very satisfied with the quality of the food. I should probably write a separate review of the Lobby @ Tribecca Grand Hotel :) Overall, I think Sheraton Tribecca is on the average side. But the Staff and Cleanliness were definitely above average. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern with great service”
Reviews.Author: Bigtime7779
Reviews.Content: We planned on staying here 2 nights for multiple concerts at Governors Island and received a group rate through the band. Due to the threat of Hurricane Irene, the Saturday show was postponed, so we tried to cancel the Saturday night reservation. When I called the hotel, I kept getting patched through to their national customer service call center. Every time I spoke to the customer service reps, they said if I cancelled the second night, I wouldn’t be able to keep the discounted rate and it would result in a rate change of $100 more since it was less than 24 hours from the first check-in day. They weren’t very sympathetic to the upcoming hurricane threat and weren’t even willing to match the current online rate, which was about halfway between the 2 rates. We decided not to cancel the 2nd night and take it up with the hotel when we arrived. Upon arrival, we asked to cancel the 2nd night so we could evacuate due to the hurricane. The friendly and helpful gentleman at the front desk said that wouldn’t be a problem and promptly cancelled the 2nd night without any rate change. We were very pleased that the employees at the actual hotel were more sympathetic to this unusual circumstance and made everything very simple and quick for us. They also let us check in 45 minutes early, so we were thrilled about that as well. The King bed room we had was very small and the bed and a chair took up most of it, but that’s pretty typical for NYC hotels. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept in, so I was pretty mad when I had to wake up at 6 AM to catch a train the next morning. Everything in the room and bathroom was very clean and modern-looking, especially the flat screen TV, phone and shower. There was also a pretty cool electronics hub in the room that could accommodate all sorts of different input and output cables for various electronics, although I didn’t have time to play around with it. I can’t really speak for the Tribeca neighborhood since I’ve never stayed in this part of Manhattan before, but everything for many blocks was closed at 1 AM so there wasn’t much nightlife around. The hotel bar closed at about 1:30 AM, so that didn’t really help our cause. I had to walk about 10 blocks just to find a convenience store that was open. The subway entrances for the 1 and A/C/E lines were both a couple minutes away, so that made it cheap and easy to navigate to various parts of the city. A final note about the Hurricane - The hotel had flyers at the front desk and elevator areas providing guests with an update of the hurricane on Friday. Even though the hotel wasn’t in the mandatory evacuation zone, they took the time to give another update to every room late Friday night asking people to leave for their safety early Saturday morning if possible, but that they’d remain open with limited services if they had nowhere else to go. This is evidence of the hotel’s genuine care for their guests and quality management during an event that’s very unusual for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: mandmshow
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel is the staff and the location. I had a number of queries before booking and these were addressed by Lowell the manager via email to great satisfaction. Tamika the night manager is one of the nicest people you could ever meet. The "breakfast lady" in the club lounge is hilarious - so nice and entertaining and natural. Nothing is an issue to any of the staff at this hotel. The bar has a really nice atmosphere as well and again the staff make the place. Did I say the staff were friendly ? Downsides - Small rooms, pay for internet Upsides - We LOVED the location. Did not feel unsafe at night like other reviews and we walked for miles day and night (by choice). It is worth paying the extra for the club room so that you get access to the rooftop balcony (and breakfast). It is a great place to enjoy a glass of wine and take in this incredible city from an unusual perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: fabry064
Reviews.Content: New hotel, but very small rooms, even wardrobe can fit just few things... Despite i m a spg platinum they didn t gibe me a suite saying it was sold out, but it was available..... And any welcome amenity in the room. Doorman offered us a private trasportatiom to' the airport wirh a suv for 7 pax when i asked for 8. Unprofessional!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: dinake
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca in July. Although I was a SP guest, they assigned me a room on one of the lower floors. I asked if there were any upgraded and the receptionist said no. I checked into my room and was shocked to see that the carpet was dirty and the room smelled musty. I opened up the drapes to the roof of the building next door that had a large industrial vent spewing green slime every 60 seconds. There was a hotel pillow on the roof outside my window. It was like a low end motel. I called the front desk and asked them to move me. I will give them credit that they immediately found me a better room (not sure why they didn't give me that room to begin with) and sent a bellman to move my stuff. the new room was even smaller and had a tiny corner window. They don't offer any perks like free coffee or breakfast. If this hotel was $150 a night, I would understand the quality of accommodations but for the rates they charge, this is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The location isn't for everyone. The suites are not suites. For the price look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Gemma'smum
Reviews.Content: This was to be a new adventure in Tribeca/Soho. I arrived with a 13 year old daughter and through our 5 night stay we had my husband join us 3 nights and my college age daughter 1 night. The location is not great for women alone or with teens. Canal street gets very empty and walking from 2 of the train lines doesn't feel safe. The location is more like Chinatown/Tribeca/Soho. Canal street is a mess. However, Tribeca and Soho can be fun for shopping and restaurants. For site seeing (museums, UN, Theater, Rockefeller Center, Central Park etc) we spent a lot of time on trains and taxis. The hotel itself is just okay. The staff vary from the bellhops which were wonderful to the front desk which was rude and hopeless. We booked a suite and asked that they have the queen sofa bed made when we arrived. When we arrived I double checked and was told it was fine. It wasn't. On the 3rd night it was finally made. The suite is actually not a suite so much as a sizeable room with a king bed and queen sofabed. If I were to do it again, I would go back to the Lucerne or one of the hotels that has true suites. I should say the air conditioning here was great for a NYC summer, the room amenities were very good and that Sheraton bed is great (the sofabed was not). We are loyal SPG fans, but sometimes it pays to look elsewhere and this hotel is not worth the cost. Also the large groups staying there meant the noise from halls was a pain if you are trying to sleep. The lobby is packed all of the time. My one serious recommendation if you stay here. When you leave the hotel go to the right (west) Great restaurants, train line to upper west side and Ya-Ya nails spa! To the left (east) and it's awful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Rebekah P
Reviews.Content: My friend and I live in the city and love to take mini vacays right in our own amazing city every now and then. I booked this hotel in a different part of town than we usually stay in on a whim and we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel itself was clean, new and spacious. Our room had a large extra comfy king bed and flat screen that we watched movies on all day. We also loved that there was a bar downstairs and a 24 hour deli right next door, which we utilized respectively. We were sad to leave this morning. Even though we live just a mile or so north of this hotel, it truly felt like we were on vacation. I recommend this hotel and can not wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “can not recommend”
Reviews.Author: islandfever74
Reviews.Content: As a frequet travellor at Starwood hotels I can not accept a $250 per nite hotel without: in room safe, adequate fitness facilities (small room, no free weights, no sauna or pool)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and pokey rooms, but good customer service”
Reviews.Author: mudpuppy24
Reviews.Content: The street on which the hotel stands, Canal Street, is not for the faint of heart. I lost count of how many fake Rolexes I was offered on my way to the subway. Yes it was grimey and noisy, but it's a fun area and a part of town where you really can say that it's the city that never sleeps. Fantastic shops and restaurants are within a very short walk, as is the subway. But it is noisy at night. I think the hotel tries to drown out the noise of the traffic by making the A/C even noisier; and gaps under the doors mean that you can hear hallway noise very clearly. The room was small, even by NY standards, and the bathroom was tiny. A little bit mean with bathroom products - only one soap and shampoo, no matter how many nights you were there - and the room was never cleaned particularly thoroughly. There were still coffee stains down the wall from a previous guest, which hadn't been wiped away. The communal areas are fine and very clean. The best thing about the hotel was the service of the staff. From the barman, to the doormen, to the reception staff, everyone was friendly, helpful, and really made you feel welcome. Oh and one piece of advice - if you want to get Starwood points (this is why I'd chosen this hotel), you can't get them if you book through Expedia, as I had done.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KarenVeilhes
Reviews.Content: Good - location, cleanliness (no bedbugs here), location, location, location, service, great shower. Bad - lack of storage space in the bedrooms, sparse toiletries and barely any coathangers. If you want to be downtown then this is a great place to be. Easily within walking distance of SOHO, Financial District, Tribeca and even the East Village if you're in shape and it's not too hot.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location and spacious rooms for NY”
Reviews.Author: SMedi_Toronto
Reviews.Content: This was a great, last minute decision to stay at the Sheraton because you can always count on their properties. Don't get fooled by the fact that you are staying on Canal St. because as soon as you cross the street, literally you are amidst the nicest restaurants and galleries of Soho. We were able to get around the entire city by train and for the most part, we walked to all of the neighbouring areas because they were so close. Soho has great resto options across the street. Walk 15 min. you are in Chinatown, and then add another 5 minutes and you will end up in Little Italy. The rooms are spacious for NY standards. The hotel concierge and staff are very friendly and give great directions and suggestions for the area. I don't let small things like the size of the bar or the lobby get to me because I don't intend to spend time there! The amenities were great and we even got an upgrade in our room even though it was an online purchase. We got in at 11am and although check-in was for 3pm, we had a room by 11:30 - super service. I would recommend this hotel to friends and would consider staying here again because of how conveniently located it is to pricey areas for less money! Shopping on Broadway is less than a 5 min. walk!

Reviews.Title: “Overpromised and under performed”
Reviews.Author: daysiees
Reviews.Content: Blech, we got in to NYC late, the check in process took a long time, the staff wasn't overly friendly, the elevators were slow and cramped and worst of all we choose Tribeca because on the website we saw there was a patio on the rooftop for drinks... nope, only for their vip program customers. The entire reason we wanted to stay there was because of this and they wouldn't budge. What a waste! Rooms weren't impressive at all, bathrooms were so-so, would not stay there again. Also I know I left some souvenirs in the room and the hotel said they weren't found. I expected more out of Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: bsannich
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is great - it is relatively new, very clean, and has a nice buzz in the lobby. The rooms have everything you would need and most (if not all) of what you would want, and are a decent size for Manhattan. The only negative I had about this hotel was the elevators. There were three available serving all 22 floors. I stayed on 18, so on the way up, it often stopped 5-6 times. And on the way down, it would be full after the first couple stops and would continue stopping every couple floors with no more room. It's minor, but something that became kind of annoying, yet expected. The location was pretty convenient to many cool areas/places....SoHo, Little Italy, Financial District, Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park, Ground Zero, etc. In my opinion, the immediate area (China Town) is a dump. But if you get a few blocks beyond, you're back to "normal" Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Addition to Lower Manhattan's Hotels”
Reviews.Author: pilatestci
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at this property for 7 nights 11-18 July 2011. We were in NYC to search for an apartment and so were pretty busy and stressed out. We wanted a place that was central to lower Manhattan while also an oasis from the city stress. As longtime SPG members we decided to try this new hotel. I reserved a club level king via SPG and was able to easily contact the hotel. We were having a few items shipped to us at the hotel and needed to coordinate with the desk. Everything arrived and was held for us! Check In: Check in could have been better. This property has been slammed with business since its opening with a host of difficulties that I hoped would have been smoothed out by the time we arrived. But when I walked in at 6pm to be told "hang on while we find a room for you" when I had a reservation booked for several weeks did not make me feel secure. It all worked out quickly and we were on our way up. Please note that the bellman didn't even offer to help us take our bags upstairs. Room: The room was small but quite well appointed. The bed was extremely comfortable, and even though we were near the elevators I had no problems with hallway noise or sleeping. Immediately upon check in engineering came up with our refrigerator (free, you just have to ask) and a "Gym in a Bag", which was a fabulous idea - mat, foam roller, exercise tubing, and a massager. The only thing we really missed in the room was a safe. There is only a safe at the front desk, not in the rooms. Club Lounge: The Club Lounge is lovely and the view from the deck is stunning. The concierges on duty were always pleasant and attentive. The Food & Beverage service, however, was lacking. Every afternoon we had the same food - samosas, some kind of sausage in pastry, fried artichokes, and various crudite. Breakfast was a bit better. The printer and fax didn't work in the Club Lounge, so anytime I needed to print or fax it was a trip down to the lobby. Room Service: We ordered room service on 3 nights, and it was consistently good food and service. Portions were HUGE! WIFI: Wifi sucked for the first day or two, but them smoothed out. Be aware that even if you have a "Free Wifi" Club Room you will need to check your bill for wifi charges. Checkout: Check out was pretty smooth, except for the previously mentioned wifi charges. We have 2 laptops, 2 blackberries, 2 kindles, and an ipad. Every single day we were charged for each device connected at $9.95 per device - that's $70 a day! Plus we had been charged for a phone call we didn't make (I never use hotel room phones; it's cheaper to pay roaming!). In the end our stay was great and the hotel served as a nice refuge from the city while giving us the space and support to get work done. We love the location - near Chinatown, Little Italy, Soho, Tribeca. Just a few blocks to Excellent Dumpling House!

Reviews.Title: “Staff made our stay extra special”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyfriends
Reviews.Content: Husband and I came to NYC to Celebrate anniversary. Our Son booked the room through priceline and got a great price. Before we arrived emailed hotel to inform of our special occasion. Not only were we upgraded, we were greeted in room with a lovely bottle of wine, and a decadent dessert. Way beyond my expectations. Stayed on club level floor which was awesome. Breakfast and afternoon snacks included. Did I mention the view from our floor to ceiling windows!! Fantastic. Cudo's to Lowell the GM for making our stay wonderful....Great location also.

Reviews.Title: “We had a super stay”
Reviews.Author: PJane202
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location ! The room we had was modern, very clean and bed-bug free ! The beds are extremely comfortable, Wifi was free and we had breakfast every morning at the lounge. The Metro is just around the corner. Plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. The Manhattan area is so easy to walk around in that we ended up walking and discovering lots on our own.

Reviews.Title: “My least favorite hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: KD123NJ
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location near my office in TriBeCa Lots of great restaurants in the area Pet friendly Friendly concierge Cons: Cheap furnishings in the room Housekeeping Amenities - e.g. no fridge in the standard room, only two bath towels provided for two people, cheap bar soap. Nothing was replenished during my 4 night stay. I also think that the front desk is full of incompetent staff. While friendly, from arrival to departure, they've completely missed the mark on my book. Case in point, upon checking out at 8 AM in the morning, I found out that there was an incorrect charge on my bill. I notified the front desk and was told that they will research the matter, and email me the correct bill within a couple of hours. I didn't hear back from them during the day. So, I came by the hotel at 5PM and was told that their accountant had left for the day and that the matter will be resolved on Monday. I told them that they knew about this problem at 8AM in the morning, so there's no excuse... I was asked who I spoke with, etc etc... After a few minutes, they printed the corrected bill for me, and said that they will refund my credit card for the incorrect charge. While the matter is resolved, it left a bad taste. There were few other examples... Anyway, I will not stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Good Location AND friendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: sp8holly
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the Canal Street address. The entrance is on Canal St and a bit gritty but around the corner is TRIBECA and across the street is SOHO.....not to mention quick access to the subways. Rooms are very modern, updated, clean and well designed. Rooms are regular size for NY which is small but the bathroom was perfect. The entire lobby area is designed as a friendly calm upscale internet cafe and bar (liquor as well as coffee et al). I loved it so much that I spent more time there for meals and going online than I had expected. Best of all was the friendly and informative staff. I believe they always went above and beyond to meet everyone's needs. The front desk was so very helpful as was everyone else. I do have to give a big 10 plus to Michael---the doormen/bellman---who worked very hard finding HARD TO FIND taxis for me so that I could make my meetings and flights. He was fun to talk to but very serious about helping me get to and from things. Last but not least, as a female business traveller, I felt safe. THANKS and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good new hotel, some flaws”
Reviews.Author: Tuuli
Reviews.Content: New, good hotel in good location. We stayed twice in July. First time we were upgraded to 16th floor (apparently room rate is higher for rooms in upper floors). The second stay did start as smoothly; we could have had a room in upper floors only for surcharge. We declined and received a fourth floor room facing opposite wall. When we were going to bed few hours later we noted sheets weren't changed after the previous guest; there was a used tissue paper and black hairs in the bed. We went to complain in the front desk. The clerk apologized, but could only offer us similar room in fourth floor; she told there was only one room available? So we ended up changing room at 12.30 am. I wasn't very happy, but it was late, I was tired and didn't feel like arguing. To be fair, this was one time incident, otherwise our room and hotel were clean and ok. The only faults were lack of safety box and drawers in room. Iron was good but hte ironing board was very low. Canal Street is very busy and there are lots of counterfeit vendors, but there are attractive streets with restaurants and shops around the block in Tribeca and across Canal Street in Soho. Several subway lines within few blocks whisk you to around New York in no time. To fetch a taxi is not very easy in front of the hotel; taxis seemed to avoid Canal Street due to heacy traffic, so we usually walked few blocks to hail a taxi. Guests can use six computers for free in lobby, but they are very slow. Many pages, eg. Open Table could not be used; they were blocked as "adult pages". There are several laundries nearby hotel offering wash and fold for 12 $ for 10 pounds. The doorman recommended us to take a towncar to JFK, it cost the same as taxi (45$ + tolls & tips =60 $). We took it as we were leaving a bit late and to get a taxi was not easy in front of the hotel. I gave the driver 70 $ and he seemed to be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly a business hotel, but acceptable at $100/night”
Reviews.Author: WarmWhite
Reviews.Content: Whether you’d enjoy the stay at Sheraton Tribeca depends on your expectations, and the price you’ve paid. If you’re a business traveler, as we were, you’ll be disappointed. The lobby was overrun by families, and the “business center” filled with giggling teenagers on Facebook. Service was mixed: the technician dispatched to our room to fix the non-functioning electronics was genteel. The night receptionist demeanor was appropriate for a prison warden. The “concierge” was downright shady, attempting to sway us into an overpriced “limousine” when all we wanted was a taxi. However, the property is fresh and the room was well equipped, albeit extremely noisy even on a high floor. All in all, it was acceptable for the $100 we paid.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: disguised_angel
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Sheraton hotel was great. We were greeted by Michael V. Michael helped us unload our car and showed us to our room. Each morning Michael greeted us and made sure we knew where we were going in the city. He always offered us a taxi or car to use from his company. Michael made us feel very comfortable and welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel, but not a good value”
Reviews.Author: AlanGP
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel. My rooms was in a corner next to the stairs and very small. I've had this size room at other nicer NY hotels, but at least they came with a view. The room was nice, but not what I would expect for a Sheraton. It has the look and quality of what I would expect at a Four Points hotel in other parts of the country. Also, the hotel is on the edge of Tribeca in a somewhat seedy section of Canal Street near the Holland Tunnel entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, don't pay for club floor”
Reviews.Author: airchristophe
Reviews.Content: Nice new modern hotel on Canal Steeet, on the edge of Chinatown and little Italy. Perfect access to subway and all the boutiques on Broadway and SoHo. HOWEVER, we had paid for an executive floor and were disappointed. We arrived at 4pm only to be asked to wait 15 minutes which turned into 30 minutes more. The lounge was poorly stocked and not clean. The fridge supposedly with soft drinks was empty and never regularly stocked. Coffee and tea available as well but no tea bags. Evening appetizers consisted of samosas and chicken skewers of average quality. The fridge still was not stocked with any additional soft drinks and the tea still absent. Breakfast in the morning was less than average, no breakfast pastries for those who didn't want eggs and bacon. The hostess present, however, was nice to go get a whole wheat croissant, that's all that was left downstairs. Silverware and plates were coffee stained ... Just an overall dirty atmosphere. We brought this to the attention to an assistant front desk manager who asked us why we didn't talk to a food and beverage manager !? We can only hope our feedback has been taken seriously. We were not expecting 5-star service but it can be a good club level lounge if there is attention to detail. For us the rate difference for the club level was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nyupstate
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Tribeca 's location, straddling SoHo (directly above), Tribeca (directly below), China Town, and Little Italy, (short walks East), make it an ideal setting for exploring these very diverse and fascinating ' real New York City' neighborhoods, with such a wide range of architectures, shopping (international designers to street-corner hat sellers), dining opportunities, (from best-of-NY (e.g. NOBU) - to great pizza-slice joints). And close-by A-C-E and #6 Subway lines offer quick access to the rest of Manhattan. The Hotel is brand new (Oct 2010), with modern and sophisticated design throughout the lobby and the guest-rooms themselves (but not stuffy, families should feel very comfortable here). The staff were very courteous & efficient, genuinely friendly and helpful, from front-desk to housekeeping. (Our transportation arrangements resulted in our arrival several hours before official check-in, but we were allowed immediate check-in to an available room - a blessing as the outside temps were mid 90s). Our 12th fl corner room was directly over Canal St, but extremely quiet, and offered a great view uptown, including the Empire State Building. Room furnishings, bedding, climate-control, flatscreen TV, and bathroom toiletries are very modern and high-quality. The 'Traditional' King (standard) room is typical NYC size (sufficient for two, but not a lot of additional space to move around), has an armoire for hanging clothes, but no chests of drawers for other storage. A single business-type desk chair offers the only sitting / eating opportunity, other than the bed itself (besides a very low -to-the-floor ottoman). We found the elevators to be very prompt (despite others' reference to the contrary in these posts- and the requirement to insert your key-card to gain access to your floor offers enhanced guest security). We had a decent rate, and highly recommend this hotel, and would rank it at the higher-end of Sheraton quality (easily 3.5 stars), with a caveat that an upgrade in room might be in order if you desire more spacious accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, and amazing in house food, and amazing bellman/valet”
Reviews.Author: Olitadedvukaj
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this place, there staff is ontop of everything, it's very clean, welcoming for kids and well trained!!, the bellman "Mike V" was very very very helpful, and great sense of humor, he shld b the new concierge, the front desk was very kind to accommodate my brother n I, even when forgetting r keys so many times, I highly recommend this place, for a weekend stay with or with out kids.

Reviews.Title: “A good find!”
Reviews.Author: poshw5
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through www.priceline.com and got a great deal I couldn't find anywhere else. The Sheraton was brand new and modern. I found the bed extremely comfortable and the room small (although thats the norm in NY!) but with every possible amenity! The one thing we did find though was that it was very noisy.. you could hear every time someone's door opened and closed (and they slammed) and people taking a shower you could hear... quite disruptive for sleep but that is the only negative.. (our room was on the 10th floor at the back of the hotel opposite side to Canal St) The location was a very short walk from the metro. Canal St isn't the most glamorous street in NY thats for sure but the Sheraton itself was great. They offer free internet in the lobby which was convenient. We did get involved in a fire alarm which made us miss our reservation at Tao but to be honest they were very good about it all and I enjoyed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite NYC Sheraton - but beware of cab problem”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: This new ( about 10 months old in July 2011) Sheraton is located on Canal Street riight in the heart of one of my wife's favorite shopping areas. It is in Tribeca and very near SOHO which means scads of good restaurants to choose among. It is very close to many of the most handy subway lines. The staff are great! The club lounge is huge, and includes a great outdoors area....actually designed to be able to easily eat in...instead of having mostly sofas and soft chairs like most other lounges. Breakfast was a bit erratic but at least is supposed to include eggs, sausage, bacon and potatoes plus normal continental breakfast stuff. Only real complaint was that it was suspicously difficult to to get a cab at 4 PM...we gave up after 20 minutes and had to take one of the relatively pricey ($50 to LaGuardia was quoted, but we negotiated down a bit) limos the bellmen offered "right away".

Reviews.Title: “Easy and well run”
Reviews.Author: WhereamInow09
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton TriBeCa while on a business trip. I found the hotel to be conveniently located to both the Financial District and SoHo. The staff were extremely nice and outgoing. A great place to stay while on vacation or on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: velojmp
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on Canal Street - so a busy, noisy area but it was very clean, small but reasonably sized room, and excellent service. A good option and the only reason I might not stay here again is a preference for midtown area of NYC...

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, pleasant - but nothing mind-blowing”
Reviews.Author: croquet_team
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed here for two nights in July. Location's decent - a 6-minute walk to the Subway, and plenty of little shops & restaurants also within walking distance. The Starbucks in the lobby is nice and the staff were helpful (as was the in-room Starbucks coffee and - almost a rarity - milk creamers!) It would have been nice to have mini fridges in the rooms, though. The bartender in the lobby lounge was quite nice - he gave me some snack mix even though I wasn't drinking - just waiting for my friends for dinner and lightly complained of hunger. Check-in staff were efficient and friendly. When I accidentally left the "do not disturb" sign on the door before heading out for the day, I got back and called the front desk for certain supplies. They were brought up promptly, and I appreciated that. Negatives: No real big negatives. There was a spot of something that looked like blood on the pure white duvet cover. There was no luggage rack in the room. The gym was nice but did not appear to have any free weights (not that I ended up using the gym - no time). The elevators were slow at peak times and once I could not get on one and had to wait another 6 minutes for the next one. It would have been nice to have two boxes of Kleenex (one in the bathroom and one outside in the room itself). The pillows were awful - some sort of foam material that felt like it was smothering my head - could not sleep the first night. I then requested down pillows and it seemed to help, although still not perfect. The decor was "bland-modern". The shower was nice and the toiletries were of good quality. I liked the full-length mirror beside the wardrobe. I heard there is some sort of open terrace on a upper floor, but I didn't get to see it. I did not eat in the restaurant situated in the hotel lobby. Overall, a nice stay. But I do wonder about the other options out there for apprx $275 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice but housekeeping threw out/took personal items”
Reviews.Author: soyrubiamad
Reviews.Content: We had enjoyed our stay until items left in the room ended up "missing" - or as the hotel staff repeatedly referred to them as "misplaced" - I tried to get the hotel to locate the items taken out of my room without success.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could rate it better...”
Reviews.Author: lovinglife_TO
Reviews.Content: I usually like Sheraton's, but unfortunately this one is not what I've come to expect from the brand.... First the good: friendly, helpful staff; usual Sheraton good computer area in lobby, given requested room (higher floor with king bed), nice view. However.... the Fitness Room left much to be desired~ some cardio machines and only ONE weight machine (which was being used by someone for most of the 30 min I was there)- no dumbbells (even though posters showed exercises needing them), not even resistance bands. There is no pool, which is usual at most Sheraton's, and I wouldn't want to be out in the neighbourhood after dark alone. I agree with the previous comment, you could probably stay at another hotel to get more value (I was eyeing the nearby Courtyard)... C'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aevegan
Reviews.Content: I stay at Sheratons all the time for business in the NYC area. This hotel was new so I figured I would give it a try. The location is good...close to the N,R, Q subway station and right on Canal street. It's an easy walk to some great food and entertainment in any direction. You're within easy reach of Little Italy, Chinatown, Tribecca, SoHo, and WTC. The lobby is small but nice and they have the standard Link setup for computer and internet usage. There's a Starbucks in the hotel which is cool. The fitness center is basically just a couple pieces of cardio equipment and a mat. No free weights at all. But I am a 24 hour member and there's an Ultra club right up the street in SoHo. The rooms are OK. Mine was clean but small (but this is pretty common in NYC). The elevators are a bit slow which is kind of a nuisance. They participate in the SPG Green program, which is pretty cool (so you can stack up on Starpoints). Overall, I would definitely stay there again. I really liked the location and the fact the everything was new was a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, superb terrace off club lounge”
Reviews.Author: lilzeppelin
Reviews.Content: Stayed three times in the hotel in June, always for one night. The first time we got such a small room, that there was no space to move, unpack, or anything. Literally, this was the smallest room I have ever had in NY, including Four Point by Sheraton Chelsea... The reason we got such a small room as Starwood Platinum was that we checked in early, requested a quiet room and there were no better rooms, and to do room change in the afternoon the front desk made it soo complicated, that it did not work out. So if you do need to check in early, make sure you are getting the room you like, rather that bother with the room change later. It is better to drop your bags, and check in later when usually better selection of rooms is available. To be fair the agent who checked us in, did try to arrange to move us to a better room, but the new shift was less than forthcoming with the move. The following morning the agent confided she could not sleep for putting us in such a small room. Two subsequent times we were allocated a much larger room, and the experience was much much better. Those rooms had Canal St orientation, and window insulation was good, the noise did not bother the sleep, and a bonus was a fabulous view of midtown as well as over Soho. The hotel gives a complimentary access to Club lounge for Starwood Platinums. They do have some cheeses, appetizers in the evening and some not very impressive breakfast spread. Please see a picture of available drinks in the lounge. I find it strange that having invested in the lounge, nicely furnished it, hotel does not bother to take drinks out of their cartons before stocking the fridge... It is also worth mentioning that the lounge is connected to an open-air terrace with amazing views as well. The location of the hotel makes it a good option for someone needing to be in financial district or Soho, Tribeca areas. It is easy to access both 1 and 6 lines of subway, and Tribeca has many restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, not very clean”
Reviews.Author: MikelWard
Reviews.Content: Not terrible, but you could find something in a better area for the same price. Also, the floors were dirty, both in the room and the corridors, and the air conditioning was loud.

Reviews.Title: “Average in Every Respect Except Location”
Reviews.Author: sf2world
Reviews.Content: Just completed a one night stay during a quick trip to NYC for work. I was very disappointed in the room size and layout. Extremely cramped and dark. The bathroom was tiny and more befitting a 1970s Holiday Inn with only the most basic amenities. And I purportedly received a "Deluxe" room. Unclear as to whether that was a Platinum upgrade. I hope not. Appears that this is a very old property so Sheraton was probably quite limited in what it could do with the place. It is absolutely not a Category 5 so don't be fooled. This is really a tourist hotel. A low 4 because of the great location (directly adjacent to Soho though Canal Street is not a nice street as everyone knows) and well maintained common areas. The Club Lounge and rooftop deck are very attractive. And the staff quite professional and friendly. I'm glad my stay was short as the room would have given me fits had I stayed there for any length of time. I have stayed at the Four Points Soho and think it's a better choice if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Great Area!”
Reviews.Author: holidaybabymomma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here this past weekend and absolutely love the hotel. We are Starwood Gold members so we used points and got a room on the 22nd floor, and access to the club lounge. The club lounge food is unexceptional and limited of course (it's free so no complaints!), but the view from the terrace is phenomenal! Our room was a standard size for NYC, which are almost always on the smaller size which is just fine. We had a floor to ceiling view of Canal Street which was great as we saw all the hustle and bustle of this very lively area. As always the beds at Sheraton are the most comfortable you will ever sleep in at a hotel - seriously. The air conditioner worked perfect and was ultra-quiet. The shower pressure was just right in a big walk-in shower so lots of room. The room was very clean and "fresh" with cool white sheets, pillows and soft fluffy comforter. The lounge bar was very nice and they have a vast selection of beers - even a seasoned beer connoisseur would be impressed and the barkeep, Tomas, was very helpful and pleasant! You are close to SOHO and China Town, and of course in the heart of TriBeca. We saw a concert at City Winery, which was within walking distance. We ate at Aqua Grill (FAB!!), also within walking distance. Had brunch at Landmarc, so good and within walking distance. We also took in the shady park on W. Broadway, literally around the corner from the hotel. We took a cab to Battery Park ($6 fare), to walk along the Hudson - so nice! You have it all here. We have stayed at almost every Starwood’s facility in NYC and this is our new favorite: great hotel, friendly staff, and clean comfortable room in a really great downtown area of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Breezy_in_Virginia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I headed up for just one night to catch a baseball game and made the Sheraton our home base. Quick highlights - great staff, very friendly and informative all around with directions, restaurant suggestions and cab info to the airport. Room was clean, water was hot, plenty of towels. Hotel is right next door to a 24 hour convenience shop which was great for more reasonably priced sodas and snacks. Also good location for the subway, shopping and general fun. Felt very secure here in the big city, no issues or challenges with being right on Canal Street. I would recommend this hotel and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: LLW61
Reviews.Content: Adult Family Ladies: Mom, 2 daughters, sister-in-law, Daughter-in-law recently enjoyed a trip to exciting New York City. We stayed at Sheraton Tribeca thru recommendation of a friend. It was the Best ! The Staff went out of their way to accommodate our early arrival, letting us store our bags, and getting us into our room way before check-in time. The Staff was very attentive, very helpful and always eager to accommodate our every need . Michael, the Doorman, was outstanding ... always so pleasant and helpful ... As there were 5 of us we couldn't get taxis so we used the clean, new SUVs always out on the curb ... they were new, clean, and great drivers ! Also,, used the subway which was just steps away ... great experience, there as well. NYC was clean, safe and so enjoyable. Rooms were nice and the Beds .... So Comfortable !!!! Great Location !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel_crazy72
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about staying at a Sheraton as I usually like a boutique hotel but liked the location and the price! This hotel is only about 8 months old so it is very clean. Had a wonderful woman check us in around 4pm Saturday (can't remember her name). We were upgraded to club level. The location is wonderful for people who really aren't that interested in mid-town etc. We were able to walk to Soho shops and great places to eat in the village. It really was a good choice and the terrace has amazing views. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “michael v is the man!”
Reviews.Author: ktdbr
Reviews.Content: bellman michael v. was knowledgable courteous and helpful and should be considered an asset to your organization.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not the best.”
Reviews.Author: beeswaxLondon
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel in my opinion. The standard rooms are very small, not claustrophobic small, but small for the price. I saw 3 rooms, the first had scuffs all up the wall and hair on the bathroom floor. The second was a corner room which was dark and had only a tiny corner window. We thought we had better keep the 3rd room we saw - it had a slightly better layout, but there were still hairs on the bathroom floor, and a small blood stain on the quilt.
