Apart from this, the room was clean and fairly comfortable, though there were noisy air conditioning units outside on the roof of the building next door. It was memorial day weekend, and pretty full, but even though we had booked a long time in advance, we were only left with the scuzzy rooms to choose from, because they allocate on a first come first served basis, and we got there quite late in the afternoon. There is no free wifi in the rooms, but the business centre in the lobby was good - I don't think I ever waited to get on a computer even though the hotel was busy. We enjoyed the Starbucks in the lobby, too. The hotel is only a ten minute walk away from Whole Foods on Greenwich St (for anyone who cares about this). Overall, I would stay here again - but only if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Just nice”
Reviews.Author: Suzy737
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sheraton tribeca for 4 nights as of 1 June. We'd booked through booking.com and therefore had a good deak, ie costs of less than usd 200 per night incl taxes. The room however was the smallest om the floor, we first thought we had a room with a view as we were located on the 20th floor but that didn't add anything special. We could barely fit our two suitcases in the room, so a bit more space to mover around would have been nice. But as said they do have slightly larger rooms from the view of the floor map. Furthermore the room was just fine. Clean with a good bed. And as we were out most of the time that was all we needed. Bathroom was relatively spacious and modern so no complaints there. Internet in the lobby is complimentary, unfortunately you'll pay usd 10 per day in your room which felt a bit outdated. We didn't took the breakfast as there are enough possibilites closeby and nobody seems to take the breakfast. Then, location. Well Canal Street isn't much fun. But you're on the edge of SoHo and so after crossing the street you're in anice neighbourhood after all. We spent a lot of time strolling though SoHo, Little Italy, Chinatown and West Village, all within walking distance from the hotel. So if we come across a good deal again I think we would stay in the hotel again... I would say: the hotel is just nice and if you're looking for a three star hotel in the area you'll be in the good place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and fun staff”
Reviews.Author: bethgames
Reviews.Content: We were 5 ladies traveling to see New York after a cruise. We only had 2 days and werent expecting much from a 2 night stay (heck, we didnt need much), but Michael V. and the desk staff were fast, friendly, and fun. No issues at all. Called for extra pillows, they were there in 5 minutes. Called for a wine key and glasses, they were there in 5 minutes. Early check in, they at least got us into 1 room to relax while the second was being finished. The suggestion for pizza around the corner at Saluggi's was fantastic!! Will come back here again for sure with the family next time. :)

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Family by entire team”
Reviews.Author: travelwithfamily14
Reviews.Content: My family and I found ourselves in a difficult situation with housing recently and needed to stay in a hotel near our children's school. The Sheraton Tribeca was like all other hotels in the area and quite full. the director of sales was very helpful in getting us a place to stay and we were able to check in on the date we hoped....first experience "relief and thanks". when we checked into the hotel we were met by Michael, Jarrett and team who quickly recognized we were a little out of sorts and made sure we were taken care of....second experience "friendly hospitality" . our check in was smooth and well handled and we were helped to our room with quite a bit of luggage....third experience "efficient grace and control". during our time there the entire team was kind to our children, truly interested in us as a family and generally just good people to us at every opportunity. As I was sensitive to the whole experience I was aware that they were treating everyone the same way, and that felt good - like they were really just good people, not doing it "for us" - they meant it and we could tell. upon check out I met with Zakia who was gracious, kind and helpful as well as professional. ..as well as Jaleel who was also helpful. I wish I could remember everyones name that we came in contact with but thank you from our family to all of you and the management team at this hotel for creating a positive environment. the hotel was clean, fresh and modern. room was perfectly fine and quiet....our housekeeping team was also on top of the situation which we appreciated....but at the end of the day the stay at this hotel was made by the people who work there. thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Good location”
Reviews.Author: KConnors57
Reviews.Content: We had a flawless weekend at the Sheraton Tribeca, we had been relocated from another Starwood Property, and in fact, more or less upgraded. While it was a little bit of trouble logistically, the staff I worked with wanted to make sure I was fully taken care of during the process, and indeed we were. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in New York City”
Reviews.Author: PattiHosking
Reviews.Content: I was greated with kindness and respect the moment my cab pulled up in front of the hotel by Michael V. He saw my last name on my luggage which he had unloaded from the cab the moment it stopped, and welcomed me by my last name. I was not feeling well and he escorted me into the hotel and introduced me to the front desk where I was able to check in early to recover. The front desk clerk was quietly, quickly accomodating and I was in my room in a few minutes with my luggage delivered. The remaining of the 4 day stay, I was treated with courteous help from the room service staff to my housekeeper to the bell staff and upon checkout. When you arrive in a city not feeling well, this service was so reassuring. Thank you again for your care.

Reviews.Title: “They just don't care”
Reviews.Author: PedroM0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, close to subway lines and walking distance to many SOHO restaurants. The rooms are quite new and the bed is comfortable. too bad I could not sleep too much. I have stayed in the hotel for 7 nights and was awaken everyday by a squeaking noise in the morning. On the third morning day I realized the noise came from the elevator door (unfo my room was close to the elevators..), spoke to the reception and they said they were going to take a look at it, no offers to change room or anything like that, just reassured me that they would take care of the problem. I went out for the day, came back late in the evening to be waken up in the following morning by the same noise. Complained again, heard their promises to solve it and next morning more squeaking.. by the 6th day I had given up complaining, it was simply not working. The funny thing is that I was actually expecting to be asked on the check out how my stay went, but no questions were asked. The staff really did not care. Will not stay in this hotel, and have serious doubts on how Sheraton is training its staff in NY, a shame. Do not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the bellman and town cars out front”
Reviews.Author: travelingpazs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May for 4 nights and had a great time. It's in a fun location right next to China town and walking distance to some great restaurants...TriBeCa Grill, Locanda Verde, and Bubbys to name a few. The rooms are TINY but we didn't mind as we don't spend much time in them. Everything was great until check-out. We checked our bags with the bellman because our flight didn't leave until 5:30. We told him we needed a cab later and he talked us into taking one of the town cars out front. I'm a frequent visitor to NYC and know that these can be a rip off so we declined at first but he insisted that they were trustworthy drivers and it would be $60 tip and tax included. We asked several times if he was SURE there wouldn't be any other charges. Once again we were reassured there were no hidden costs. We decided to go with it as it seemed the Sheraton was endorsing it. We also made sure the driver knew ahead of time we were going to two different terminals. When we arrived at the first terminal and my friend was getting her baggage out the driver told us we owed him $65 for the ride to the airport and another $15 to go to another terminal. We told him we weren't paying him anything extra as we had already negotiated the price with the bellman. He told us he didn't care what the bellman said, we owed him more. I got on the phone and called the Sheraton and explained our situation to the woman who answered. I asked if this was some kind of scam they were running on their guests. She assured me no it wasn't, their drivers are very trustworthy. She then connected me to the front desk where I explained again what was happening and this woman got the bellman on the phone who requested to speak to the driver. I handed my cell phone to the driver and after a few minutes the driver hands me my phone back and tells me fine, I'll drive you to the next terminal and he was not happy about it. I didn't feel comfortable getting in his car so I said no thank you and took the airbus to my terminal. Again, I wouldn't NEVER have taken the car if the bellman hadn't reassured me over and over that it was a trustworthy service. If I didn't have the nerve to call the hotel or had been in a big hurry I would have had to pay the driver more. I was disappointed in the Sheraton for allowing something like this to happen but was relieved the situation was handled promptly. I've lost some faith in them though, and I will probable stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: RASG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca just to get away for a night. We chose this hotel because we could stay using SPG points and because my husband works in midtown and wanted to get away from his work environment. The location is a good, central to lots of great downtown neighborhoods. The hotel is very clean, our room was nicely appointed and we had a wonderful view of the midtown skyline. The standard room isn't big, but it's fine for New York standard. The staff was helpful and friendly. They gave us a GREAT dinner restaurant, just around the corner called Pepolino. The staff was all smiles, a really friendly crew. There is a basic bar in the lobby and a nice breakfast area for a quick coffee and bite to eat. I would recommend this hotel as a no frills, but a clean and friendly stay. Very nice. No complaints from me!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: lynx74
Reviews.Content: Huge room for a "standard" in NYC. It's a great location and surprisingly quiet for being directly on Canal. I was traveling with a small child and the entire staff remembered his name, greeted him in the morning - even recalled the name of his stuffed animal. A great home base for sight-seeing and taking in all of New York. The only thing i would ask is that - DUDE, for the price, how about free wi-fi?

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: beulahrit
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is very friendly and helpful. I especially want to commend Zakiya for going out of her way to help me and a colleague find a quiet place to work on a project.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie_Ben
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here in April 2011 for about 10 nights. We were in New York City for the Tribeca Film Festival as we were part of a film that had its World Premiere there ( Love Hate Love). ALL the staff at Sheraton Tribeca ensured our stay with them was delightful. Nothing was ever a problem for them and they went out of their way to make our stay memorable. Lowell the General Manager went out of his way to ensure our stay was perfect. It was great to be witness to a GM that doesnt just stay in his office and was constantly seen mingling with guests and making sure their stay at his hotel was a memorable and hassle free one. The hotel and our room were immaculately presented and we certainly will be staying here again when we return to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Tribeca? No way”
Reviews.Author: Elmegale
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at chinatown. Horrible Street. There is no safe or minibar at the rooms, the breakfast is bellow the average. Definitely not a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mimi0622
Reviews.Content: First I want to say is that I work for a hotel so I know the procedures very well. I booked a room with DD for 2 adults and a teenager. I know room types are not guaranteed but I've never heard of being charged extra for another bed. Then I asked for a possible upgrade and how much, they came back with a "suite" which has a sofa bed in it hat was an additional $150 for the same size room but with a sofa bed. I know a suite is usually bigger than a standard room and more money. So basically all 3 of us slept on the king bed. So if you stay here with your family please be prepared to sleep together or spend more money. The only good thing about this hotel was the location!!!

Reviews.Title: “great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobbin80
Reviews.Content: Just built in october, nice, clean and contemporary hotel. Located on canal street, right across the street was the edge of SOHO, short walk to the west side and Chelsea districts. Great shopping and galleries close by the hotel. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good sheraton”
Reviews.Author: ChillyAlbertans
Reviews.Content: Of the star wood collection I find Sheraton the least consistent. This is a new and well located Sheraton. Nothing special in the rooms, but perfectly clean and functional. The lounge is very well stocked for such a small space. Staff all excellent except one manager who clearly has not heard the notion that the customer is always right. After a heated exchange with me about room rates for a colleague he was properly overruled by another manager who apparently had heard the dictum. He looked foolish. Pass on the restaurant...truly horrible. Lots of great eateries close by. Would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and service!”
Reviews.Author: flatcolor1
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Tribeca met our expectations and more. The club level observation deck has a beautiful view and the continental breakfast exceeded our expectations. The room was clean, and while not exceptionally big, it was modern and had a great view. The shower was great and the water pressure was perfect. The Sheraton Tribeca is located on the border of Tribeca and Soho. There is lots of shopping to be had on Broadway, which is only 4 or so blocks away. Walking distance to Chinatown and Little Italy make for a nice visit as well. If you are a vegetarian, there is a place called 'Dojo' at 14 W 4th St(Btwn Bway & Mercer St). They have an excellent Soy Burger dinner with a soy burger patty, salad and brown rice for 5.25.. Thats right, only 5 bucks, unheard of for a dinner/lunch in Manhatten. Its a casual sit down place that also serves beer/ liquor. If you are looking to save money on your stay at the Sheraton Tribeca, there are some great options. If you need a quick snack, there is a cheap deli next door with everything from pizza, to sandwiches, subs and more. On the corner of W. Broadway and Canal there is a Bodega where you can buy beer to bring to your room if you dont want to spend crazy money on booze at the bars or club. If you have club-level access you can bring your drinks up to the 21st floor observation deck and enjoy the sights and sound of the city in style. If I had one complaint, it would be this. I booked my trip on Priceline.com and was supposed to get a Deluxe King room, with Club Level access. On check in there was no mention of the club access and when I tried to access the 21st floor for the club lounge I was denied entry and had to call down and explain to them my situation. They were happy to help, and looked up my reservation, and confirmed that I was indeed supposed to have that access, so Im not sure why it was missed in the first place. It caused some embarrassment, as I booked the room as a surprise for my girlfriends birthday and when the key card didnt work to the club lounge, the surprise was cut short and spoiled as we had to back to the room to call the front desk. Thats a small thing I guess overall, and my suggestion would be to make sure inadvance that they know you have club level access if you book through an outside source. It will save yourself some time/ embarrassment/ hassle. I travel to NYC frequently and would most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently The Best in New York”
Reviews.Author: sabbate
Reviews.Content: I wrote once previously about this hotel and gave it a great review, however I think the true test of a hotel is in it's consistency. I have stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca on Canal Street four times. I typically come in on business but the last time I stayed an extra day to enjoy New York. The beds are so comfortable that I get a beetter night sleep here then at home. I think I need a new bed at home. The staff is extremely helpful without that New York edge that many hotels have. The location can't be beat. a $6 cab ride lands you in midtown and the subway is just around the corner if you want to save a couple of dollars. One tip is that some cab drivers do not know where the hotel is. Just tell them that it is next to the post office on canal street. This hotel has it all: location, good value, comfortable rooms, good food, convenience and a delightful staff. You just can not go wrong. I stay in 80 hotels a year and this is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, interesting Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jill in Florida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, has it all going for it. It is close to Soho, Tribeca, Little Italy, NoLita. The rooms were a nice size for NYC, and the concierge floor was very nice. We were given an upgrade due to Starwood Status. Maryann, the concierge was excellent and tried to please in every way. We have stayed at the Sheraton Soho which has a more neighborhood feel, but this one is literally on Canal Street, a part of Chinatown. It is only a ten minute walk to less hustle bustle and has a lot of computers for your use on the main floor that are free for you to use, and a Starbucks and nice Bar too. Really great property especially if you have things to do in the Tribeca area. Nice Gym too.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Go Back”
Reviews.Author: oakville_ONMilo
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the reviews for this hotel, so I booked a three nights' stay with my daughter, who is 18 years old. The hotel itself was OK - the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice. Tiny room, though. Our room backed on to a huge Post Office sorting centre, so I could hear the vans loading up early in the morning! We would generally arrive back at the hotel at around 11:00pm and the walk back from the subway was quite unnerving as there were quite a few "colourful" characters around at that time of night. I would have felt fine if my husband had been with us, but we really felt vulnerable. The deli next door was a great place to grab breakfast or a late night snack - I believe it's open 24 hours. In hindsight, we would have been better off staying closer to Time Square, where we spent most of our evenings watching shows.

Reviews.Title: “There were three people who made our stay memorable because of the kind efforts they made to made us happy.”
Reviews.Author: peace033
Reviews.Content: Nadir in the hospitally room went out of his way to get us honey or whatever we needed. Micheal V. always managed to get us a cab. He works from his heart and the Sheraton is lucky to have these people. Jarrett was a doll too.

Reviews.Title: “New, Sleek and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Margalita4NJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Sheraton Tribeca NY. Took the kids there for spring break to see the sights. There's no parking at the hotel so we self parked across the street at Wooster parking on Wooster street. You can also drive your car to the entrance and they'll valet park for you at Wooster. Our self park price was $41/night--high but that's big city for you! The best thing about the hotel is its location. Canal Street is very busy with shops and vendors. Very close to Holland Tunnel but with NY traffic, it takes awhile to get there. Close to subway and Chinatown is nearby. Plenty of Chinese restaurants on Mott Street. Dunkin Donuts across the street and McDonald's down the street. There's also a bagel shop right next to the hotel. We ate at McDonald's one morning and it was close. We also went to a Thai Restaurant named 35 which is very very close to the hotel. My husband found it on an App and it had good reviews so we tried it. Food was very good and reasonable. Our family of 5 stayed in a room with 2 double beds. My kids, 14,12, and 5 slept in one bed and we slept in the other. The room size is neither big or small for NY but it's very tight for us. They did not have rooms with sleeper sofas. The elevators are very slow and you need your room key to access. Decor is modern and sleek and the beds are comfortable. We got there before check-in time so they held our luggage for us so we can start our sightseeing. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like mistakes and disinterest, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mikkey1101
Reviews.Content: First, I was placed in a room (supposedly a jr. suite) with the desk, TV, chair etc right in front of the window; the TV 12 inches from the bed on the extreme left. On the website, you see only floor to ceiling windows, so I called after a few claustrophobic moments, and they gave me a smaller room, but I got the floor to ceiling windows. Room service during the royal wedding was a joke. They did not deliver what was on the menu, had multiple omissions, and the breakfast was late and cool. Oh, and 1 pot of water for tea with one tea bag (no selection of Tazo teas). This seems trite, but here is the big thing. I budget! I keep what I can charge in my account (bank credit/debit). I go out to a show and dinner, and my credit card is rejected (with plenty available). They keep my license and tell me to go to the show...straighten it out later. Well, couldn't enjoy the show, went back to the restaurant and still the card is not good. Couldn't use debit as we took out the limit...but there's plenty available. Call my parents to get a card number to pay the bill after the show...embarrassing! Of course the night was a disaster. Called my credit union the next AM, and they tell me the Sheraton charged...CHARGED my card an extra $400.00 IN CASE I ordered anything else. Now, if there are any attorneys out there, isn't charging my account without my authorization (and without telling me) a felony or at least fraud. I could have been arrested the night before, lost my job and reputation....everything, and were they Rabda or Steven (the manager) reactive or understanding....NOPE! Too bad, so sad! This is how we do it. Well, I've stayed all over the world. The hotels have the credit card info...if you left with a towel, they'd charge you. I believe this is the worse hotel experience I've had, save Costa Rica, where a friend died because of no medical supplies on premises (AED). So, what to do? Review, blog, and hopefully find a good attorney because I could have lost everything because of the jerks at the desk and in accounting. Don't stay here. They don't care about you.

Reviews.Title: “by far the best exprience ever in an untraveled location”
Reviews.Author: jackiemike042783
Reviews.Content: my wife and i traveled to new york for our tenth wedding anniversary and our first time ever leaving the state of florida, not knowing what we were in for we would soon find out. upon arrival we were first greeted by michael one of the bellman and i must say the abosolute best at his job an asset to your company, we were allowed to check in early, our luggage taken to our room for us by another bellman all is good.we settled in and went dinner at the restaurant on property of which was great, then to the starbucks of which the entire staff was magnificent we never waited for anything we were on first name basis from the first visit and for the whole week as soon as they seen us every morning they had our order ready for us. as if the attention to detail was not enough on the day of our anniversary , one of the hotel managers i cant remember his name but day to day he greated me by my first name which i thought was awesome being is he deals with so many people on a day to day basis, anyways on our anniversary he saw us having breakfast in the lounge he came up to me and told me in honor of our anniversary breakfast was on them and to come back for a speacial dinner also on them, i felt so impressed, i told them we felt like family there and were made to feel right at home.we come from a small island in florida that is totally tourist based and i can tell you that hotel you guys have there is very speacial , whatever you guys are doing dont stop you are for sure top notch in our book, we are already planning our next stay, sincerly jackie & michael cervantes, key west fl.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Memberger
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Location is close to subway stations, making it easy to move around. Rooms are of reasonable size (for NY even good), clean and comfortable. Maybe breakfast does not make it into the top 10.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly warm in trendy center”
Reviews.Author: traveler4you33139
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel in an amazing area of NYC. I am a Corporate traveler, senior management, and this hotel had one of the best views of the Empire State building I have had to pleasure to view from my room on the 16th floor. The staff from check-in, maid service and bar personnel where friendly, welcoming and professional. The room was extremely comfortable, state of the art connections and no street noise! The film festival was in progress and yet the hotel never seemed hurried or congested. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Property - Inconsiderate General Manager”
Reviews.Author: sd130
Reviews.Content: Question: What do you do when you are the Manager of a hotel in Tribeca during the Film Festival and the market prices on your room has increased dramatically but you are sold out and unable to benefit from this rising demand? Answer: You re-run the every credit card that was held to use a room and you re-sell any were the credit card has since expired. I tried to check in and was told my room had been given away. The city was entirely sold out and it was impossible to get another room. There were 4 parties stranded in the lobby in the exact same situation all trying to find a bed to sleep in because this property gave away all of our rooms (at we can assume is a much higher rate) If you book a hotel months or weeks in advance, why is the property only checking the reservation hours before check-in?! This hotel is run like a sleazy motel. I can't rate the rooms cause I never saw one, but I can strongly tell all travelers to avoid due to a money-hungry management team that will throw you out on the street if there is an opportunity to make a few more dollars. I know there were lots of people left in this same situation this week. Please do as I have done and post your account online. It's shady business practices like this that need to be stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding employee and front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: dilligaf2u
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed this is hotel 4-14-11. There was a young man that worked at the concierge's desk, his name is Micheal. You could tell he loved his job and went above and beyond to help us out. First he brought my husbands laptop that he left in the lobey up to our room. Then he helped with directions, going on line because I could not remember the name of where we wanted to go, got us a map and helped with train info also. He is such a pleasant young man. Actually the front desk staff were all welcoming and very helpful. Thank you Barbara Fuchs

Reviews.Title: “Scam alert - all rooms non-refundable, charging you extra & deceptive practices”
Reviews.Author: rose-spork
Reviews.Content: Room types are listed as: "Traditional King - Non-refundable" and for $25 more, "Traditional King." Now, a rational person would assume that one of those room types is refundable and one is not. That you are risking saving $25 if you are 100% sure plans will not change. Sadly, this is not the case. both room types are non-refundable, and they are happily ripping you off if you choose to pay $25 extra in case plans change, because if they do, you will still be billed in full. Shame on you, Sheraton Tribeca.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of SOHO & Tribeca with easy access to everything”
Reviews.Author: BBetcha
Reviews.Content: What a great location. Just north of Tribeca and at the start of SoHo, this new hotel is exactly where my wife and I wanted to spend our couples get away in NYC. We had a good size room that was very clean and faced north looking right at the empire state building. We couldn’t have asked for a pretty view at night with the lights of NYC twinkling. The bed was so comfortable my wife wanted to buy one to bring home. Thank goodness we took the train down. We splurged a bit and got a club level room. This was definitely worth it, not only because of the freebies they hand out but because the club lounge has the best view in the whole hotel up on the 21st floor with a huge patio with a 270 degree view of new york. Everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful. The bell man even suggested a great breakfast place called Bubbies a few blocks away. The hotel is right around the corner from a bunch of great restaurants in Greenwich Village and SoHo. The place we ate at on Friday night was perhaps one of the best we have ever been to anywhere. The place was called David Burkes Kitchen. I knew the name from Top Chef but was still impressed by what was served. I will definitely return to the Sheraton Tribeca hotel and am already planning my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: a_travel_monkey
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Tribeca is a relatively new hotel downtown, close to the trendy shops in SoHo. My room was stylishly decorated, in good condition and very clean. The room was not very large, but fine for a night's stay, and the bed itself was very comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed and the shower had good water pressure. The bathroom amenities included a hair dryer, soap, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion. There were also coffee and tea making facilities in the room, but no fridge. What continues to bug me about the big chains is that they continue to charge for internet access. This was partly mitigated by "The Link" facility in the lobby which consisted of multiple PCs with internet access in a new environment in which you could work. There is free wifi, but from what a colleague said, it sounded like there was a limit to the number of people who could use it at the same time. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and there is an onsite restaurant and the staff were friendly. Would I stay here again? If I had a meeting downtown, then maybe, although I suspect there may be slightly cheaper options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Worth what you spend”
Reviews.Author: mmoyaert
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but in NYC you have to expect it. Its in Tribeca, so only about a 30 minute walk to Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “WE want to GO AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: MsChu
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable time. There is so much to see and a week is not long enough. The hotel was new, the room was small, but the staff there was fantastic. Notably, Jarrett Royster went above and beyond the call of duty. We were never at a loss, because they answered all of our questions and made sure we got what we needed. We enjoyed getting around via the wonderful subway system and always felt safe. The best part is that it is very inexpensive. The location of the hotel is its biggest draw because you are very close to Little Italy, Chinatown, SoHo and World Trade Center. The entrance to the Subway is a few steps away. Bring money, New York is not a cheap vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel -Even Better Service”
Reviews.Author: Caseball
Reviews.Content: I took my two eldest kids on a trip to New York to celebrate my retirement. I had booked this hotel via our local travel agent (requesting a treble room, all endored on travel documents). On arrival we found that we had been booked a double! (Not the hotels fault, but Gold Medal). Rather than engage in the usual shoulder shrugging and 'it aint our fault' attitude that you get in some places, the duty staff, Zakiya McFayden and the day manager Steve Lamour made every effort to get us accomodated. Although they dont do trebles, Steve took us to several rooms that he felt may be suitable, eventually sorting us a very pleasant room that included a comfortable fold out couch. Not satisfied that we were getting the best from our accomodation and expectations Steve also gave us complimentary access to facilites that we hadnt booked. The hotel itself is set on Canal Street, a busy road near the Holland Tunnel which on occasion can get hectic with commuter traffic. We didnt find any issue with the traffic noise. After all, you ARE in one of the busiest cities in the World. You just have to turn on the air con if its too hot, and close the window! Our room was comfortable, well maintained, and had that clean smell you'd expect with daily visits by the cleaning staff. The usual room facilties (TV/tea & coffee, etc) were availble. The fold out couch was more than enough for me, and the hotel arranged extra bed linen/quilt. The hotel itself is well decorated and maintained. The staff are pleasant, accomodating, and refreshingly knowledgable about both Tribeca and New York in general. The food and drink prices are on a par with what you would get at any tourist city hotel anywhere in the world so I dont have any issues. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. As a base for exploring NYC we found it completely suitable for our needs. Set in quieter surrounds than any hotel near the mayhem that is Times Square. We had easy access to the subway/buses, or indeed a very pleasant walk up to Midtown along either Avenue of the Americas or 5th Avenue. The staff again need mentioning because they prevented this holiday turning into a disaster. They DIDNT need to provide complimentaries as it wasnt the hotels fault, but the fact that they did can only exemplify the very high standard od customer care & service...... Next time we head for New York City I know where to book.....

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay until I went to the restaurant...”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedBusTrav
Reviews.Content: I had enjoyed my hotel stay until I went to the restaurant for breakfast. There was only one other person in the restaurant, so I could not have anticipated what was about to occur. I was seated straight away, and the server took my order immediately which was great. He also brought my beverage to me without delay. I ordered an egg white omelet listed on the menu, so no special order. I was then asked if I wanted fruit or potatoes and I opted for the fruit. However, I then sat for over 15 minutes without my food arriving. I did not get told by the server that there was any particular issue or delay in the kitchen. As I was getting increasingly frustrated, given that the restaurant was dead and no one except myself had ordered any food during this entire time (the 1 other person's food arrived a few minutes after I sat down ... I have no idea how long he waited for his!), I got up from my seat and walked over to the host area and asked if he was the manager. He said yes, I told him what had happened, and he then said he would go back to the kitchen to inquire. Meanwhile, a few minutes after I returned to my seat, another server brought my omelette and it had potatoes instead of fruit on the plate. I then asked for an explanation regarding why the order took so long AND why I was being given potatoes when I ordered fruit instead. This server was not the one who had taken my order, so she looked surprised and said she would return with it fixed. I then waited several more minutes, and it arrived. The manager then returned to the table to give me the most lame explanation, he said that the kitchen supports several areas of the hotel (room service, some club, etc.) as if that was supposed to make me feel better. I then said that it was shocking that it took 20 minutes to get an omelette when there was only me and one other person in the restaurant, he then repeated his previous explanation that the kitchen supports more than just the main restaurant. I then suggested that maybe there is not enough staff to which he responded by saying there are 2 chefs and this is the right amount and lack of staff is not the explanation. He then said he would comp the meal (would have been shocked at this point if he had not done so). The further upset was that although the omelette and fruit were ok -- nothing to write home about! -- the toast was burned! As I left the restaurant, I told him that I left the burnt toast and that I would be going to write this up on Tripadvisor. This was very unfortunate because although the hotel is on a very busy street -- Canal -- it is priced relatively well and is new which makes for a reasonably comfortable and good value hotel in New York. However, after the experience with the restaurant, I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: cyoo1
Reviews.Content: The hotels rooms itself are decently sized, but if you don't have a means of transportation catching a taxi on that side of town can be a bit difficult. As far as customer service...during my stay I had no major problems with Sheraton Tribeca, but not following through with complete customer service for guests after their stay means no returning clients! After staying almost a week at Sheraton Tribeca I realized I left behind my trench coat in the closet of my hotel room. I called the next day and found out that it was missing, but no other guests were assigned to that room. And no one but the cleaning lady was in it (the other woman that cleaned the room earlier during my stay remembers seeing my trench coat). The only solution they would provide for me was to claim it on MY insurance. After refusing I spoke with the manager of housekeeping who had to report this situation to the front office manager. It has been over a month since my theft and I have yet to hear back from this manager, Steven LaMoore. Whenever I call to speak to him, I only get that he's in a meeting or he's not available and emails and messages are supposedly sent to him to contact me back. I am told that he is busy but not even a courtesy call to let me know that he is aware of my situation or even an email in response would be polite. Maybe if I take legal action and file for litigation I will be taken seriously. I feel disrespected to not even get any sort of response back from the ONLY manager that seems in charge of matters of this nature. Sheraton boasts of making several billion dollars worth of renovations, but maybe they needn't have to go to that extremes of drawing customers to their hotels if they focused more on hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, management is very customer friendly, healthy flavorful restaurant food”
Reviews.Author: Abigailadamsn00
Reviews.Content: A great location for a very busy relatively new hotel. The rooms are small, very efficiently laid out and very comfortable. Clearly a lot of planning went into making the most out of the space. A great find is the restaurant which has healthy selections, (along with buffalo wings, which a fellow restaurant patron raved about) that are flavorful. After a long cross country flight and not wanting to go out again, we had soup in the restaurant and it was great. The restaurant staff and the food and beverage manager are terrific, very accommodating and friendly. Some of the front desk staff (day and night) seemed more impressed with themselves than with helping guests-we suggest more training or a new staff. The senior management is terrific and responded immediately to our concern about our floor becoming a weekend party location for locals and an error in the billing process. Overall, a great property-Sheraton should be proud.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe no longer a hidden gem . . .but still a gem”
Reviews.Author: traveler60601
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice over the past two months (for business) and thoroughly enjoyed each stay. Small but efficient and very comfortable rooms, some with great city views (Empire State Building etc). Staff attentive and helpful, esp. the doormen. GREAT location at TriBeca, Chinatown, Bowery area near great restaurants and shops. Stayed above 12 and 16th floors each time and still heard some city employees working on the street, but it was not too bad and the vent/fan provided excellent white noise. Did not use the fitness room but checked it out -- it is limited and basically only useful for a few cardio machines but I understand there is not a lot they can do there. Did not eat at the hotel as there are a million different and excellent food choices nearby. Will definitely return and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Anytime I go to NYC, this is were I will stay!”
Reviews.Author: Basma954
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The service was out of this world. The doormen were always friendly and helpful (thank you Paul, Manuel, Michael V. & Michael D.) The concierge always recommended great spots to eat from his own experiences (thanks Hubert). Our housekeeper even left us notes to have a great day (thanks Huimin). The hotel was so modern and super clean. If you visit NYC and like to visit the Greenwhich Village/Soho/Tribeca area (like I do every year), then this is your hotel. I still can't believe the deal we got with this amazing hotel. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern efficient clean and friendly hotel. Great value for nyc”
Reviews.Author: kbatlanta
Reviews.Content: Like all NYC hotels, the room was small. But very modern, well decorated and appointed, very convenient to subway, soho, and downtown locations. The club lounge was terrific for free breakfast and drinks. Nice lobby with free internet. Great value and really nice choice for downtown NYC.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: ck1153
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly and very helpful, provides excellent service consistently. The General Manager has a hands-on style, is accessible and pro-active. I've stayed at several hotels in New York - there is no doubt in my mind that the Sheraton Tribeca is my only choice when I return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice rooms small but its NYC”
Reviews.Author: harcrn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with girlfriend when she came to visit and overall hotel was not a disappointment. Rooms were very small, but as my title says its NYC. The door men were very helpful and the receptionist was very nice. Did not eat but did have coffee from their Starbucks inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again (and again)”
Reviews.Author: Udiny
Reviews.Content: I don't normally have the time to write reviews, but this hotel simply earned it. The hotel looks new. My room was fantastic, clean, new, big, nice decorated. Couldn't ask for more. Semi-Starbuck for coffee in the hotel lobby. Canal street is busy yukky, but you are seconds from soho, little italy, china town, lower east side and tribeca. I lived in Soho many years and for me it was perfect location. The rate was ridiculously low. (I paid $120 on a weekend, and be happily pay $200-$250 if had too). Staff is super helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I think i should keep this hotel a secret, but it is so great i have to share”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_Paulb
Reviews.Content: What a great addition to the Sheraton family! This brand new hotel is in a really funky neighbourhood, with amazing subway access. Our room was a good size for NYC, with some quirks (like no chest of drawers?) but super comfy and amazing views. The staff was brilliant -- everyone we interacted with was first rate. If you are a midtown person the neighbourhood may not be for you, but we will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend - can't say enough good things about this hotel - recommend it highly!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerALP
Reviews.Content: Visited the City last weekend with my 17-year old daughter and some friends who are thinking about going to college in NYC. We got in around 8 or 9pm on Friday night after a long day of driving and were immediately greeted by helpful, friendly staff. We were shown to our rooms and invited to visit the Club Lounge. As we'd gotten there so late, Gilbert was wrapping up the evening goodies and leaving the club as we got there. He went out of his way to ensure we got plates and helped ourselves to anything we wanted from the cart before he wheeled it away. He was on top of things in the mornings for breakfast, too. No matter that he'd left late the night before. He always had a smile and friendly, helpful conversation for us as we relaxed. The breakfast choices were delicious and plentiful. The view from the rooftop deck was beautiful. The city at night can not be outdone. The hotel is walking distance from China Town, Little Italy and SoHo. We were able to walk to nearly everything we did. A short walk put us on the subway for our excursion to Times Square. It felt like the whole city was at our doorstep. Overall the staff was friendly and helpful beyond compare. I really felt that they would go out of their way to fulfill any request that we had. I would like to thank Lowell Beebe-Center, the manager, for all his help in arranging the weekend. The accommodations we had and how we were treated by the staff helped to make it a wonderful weekend. If our daughter chooses to attend a college in the City the Sheraton Tribeca will be our 1st choice when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished hotel, good sized rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: MissTravel22
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from SoHo, clean, new, modern hotel. Housekeeping was not fantastic but generally ok. Room was quite big for NYC, the only thing that we lacked was a bath tub. One excellent point: the hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby, so you don't have to take the hotel breakfast or to get out of the hotel. The doormen were extremely friendly and well-mannered, the reception staff was helpful. The hotel provides computers free of charge in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: brrtee
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location for shopping in Soho and the best for jumping on the subway to go uptown or down to World Trade Center location. Beds are comfy, rooms are tight and functional, staff is very helpful. My only negative about this hotel is the lack of concierge. There is a desk for a concierge but I didn't see anyone during the 5 days that we were there. Conveniently there is a little cafe next door where you can get fresh fruit and bagels etc. for breaky and cheap too! Check out Bubby's for a meal at Hudson and Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Location, Comfy Bed!!”
Reviews.Author: murphy713
Reviews.Content: We were here for the long weekend in February and had a great time! We loved the neighbourhood - not touristy, with tons of great restaurants and bars around. So close to SoHo and the trendy lower East Side! Also, sooo many subway stops nearby so all of NYC's sights are easy to get to. The staff were amazingly friendly and so helpful. We didn't find it too noisy, and had great sleeps in the comfortable bed. A great spot with great value for an NYC weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Sheraton Tribeca, so close to Soho!”
Reviews.Author: jill2beans
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal to stay at the Sheraton Tribecca. I didn't realize it was so close to downtown Soho. Walking distance to great shopping and my favorite place for brunch - Felix's. It's a new Hotel everything was so clean. And the beds are unbelievably comfortable and it was nice & quiet for sleeping. The doorman Michael D. was very helpful and friendly as well as the rest of the staff. If I could find anything negative to say, I guess it would be breakfast could have been better, although they do have starbucks coffee. And the lighting in the room was a little dim. Otherwise, we had a fantastic time!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny”
Reviews.Author: Astoria_NYZinzi
Reviews.Content: The loaction of this hotel is nice if you want to be in the Chinatown/Tribeca area. Just keep in mind the lobby area/bar is so small. You can move around the lobby area, especially if there is a line at the front desk. The rooms are rediculously small. Think twice!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was so nice!”
Reviews.Author: JRP07
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was very, very friendly. They could have been snooty, being Tribeca and all, but they were very fun, down to earth and welcoming. The room was one of the bigger NYC hotel rooms I have seen, and also one of the quietest. If you set the fan on low to medium, you won't hear the heavy traffic below (very close to Holland tunnel entrance). Rooms also have cool turn of the century photographs of the area (instead of lame hotel 'art') which I spent a lot of time studying with interest. We had a glorious view straight uptown with the Empire State bldg. taking center stage. Everything was much better than I anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: markbanshee
Reviews.Content: My review partially factors in the incredibly good room rate I got. I assume this is because its an off time and the hotel is slowly trying to build a customer base. So, keeping in mind the price, this is a steal and a 5 out of 5. Assuming the rate goes back to a normal NYC hotel, I would still say this is a very good hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the concierge/bellman did a great job helping me out with a Valentine's Day gift for my wife. The rooms are very modern and clean with a good bed, bathroom and HD TV with separate outlets to plug in a USB or HDMI device. If you are a SPG member or just get lucky enough, a Canal Street facing room gets you a great view of uptown New York. As for location it is 2 blocks from the Holland Tunnel which is great if you are driving there on off-hours. It is also in between 4 different subway lines. As a launching point to go uptown or to walk around Tribeca and SoHo, this is a great spot. Also, they allow dogs for free which is a huge bonus if you plan on bringing a canine friend along.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: JonJonMontreal
Reviews.Content: Spent the week-end february 4th to 6th. Nice hotel, very clean, friendly staff, very helpful. I was on the 21st floor. Great view. Hotel was steps from chinatown and various subway entries.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cdacunha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca a few weeks ago when I was in town for business. The accommodations were great! The rooms are extremely clean and new. It's a great location and staff is very friendly and helpful. I liked it so much that I will be back in February.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new hotel...not for afternoon naps!”
Reviews.Author: ScottLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: I watched them build this hotel from day 1, and couldn't wait to stay there. Yesterday's snowstorm gave me that opportunity. I checked in at 3pm, and all I wanted to do was take a nap. IMPOSSIBLE as the hotel fronts Canal Street...the street between the Manhattan Bridge and the Holland Tunnel. Non-stop gridlock and horns honking until about 7 or 8pm. Unless you are looking for a view of the Empire State Building, I would suggest you ask for a room that is NOT facing Canal Street. The rooms are average size for new York...but it's new, so it's nice. Was not a fan of the $9.99 wi-fi charge. And be careful...their network blocks some websites. The rooms are a bit pricey. Overall, had a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Draconian Internet Policy”
Reviews.Author: rigo5
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but insane internet policy. They block almost everything - its worse than your in house IT watchdog. A style website was blocked because of: "Bikinis/Lingerie". That's pretty draconian. Loosen up, management, it's not like I'm running my webcam porn business out of your posh TriBeCa hotel! Maybe you can lecture me about God and morality over my continental breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service Experience”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneJ77
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the first time because of its proximity to Tribeca and Soho and because it was a new hotel. I couldn't have been more impressed. The staff from the moment we walked in was friendly and helpful and made you feel like you were family. The design of the lobby was beautiful - I enjoyed the area where you could surf the internet and my Mom and I had a wonderful relaxing time at the bar after our Broadway show. The proximity to the subways was excellent as well - several train lines to choose from close to the hotel. The sleeping experience was outstanding - my daughter was reading the tags on the pillows and sheets to see if she could order them! I look forward to visiting in the summer when I can take advantage of havng a cocktail on the roof top terrace with the best views of Manhattan. The management of this hotel should be commended for the outstanding people that were hired - from the cleaning woman who was so cheerful, to the friendly bartender , to the concierge who greeted us warmly each day.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: howardlover
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Tribeca is a great downtown hotel. The staff is AMAZING! From the door men to reception to room service to the staff at the coffee bar - everyone was beyond nice and helpful. I was so impressed with the service. The location is great. I spent a lot of time seeing plays on Broadway and the subway to the Times Square was a quick direct trip. The subway is just a short two blocks from the Sheraton. I would suggest that the Sheraton consider adding movies on demand to their TV systems. The only downside was the door to the room. There are a few open inches between the bottom of the door and the floor board. It makes for a noisy experience if you have active neighbors. I would definitely return to this hotel! Another great addition to Starwood's properties.

Reviews.Title: “The most pleasant stay at a New York City Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: egraz16
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Sheraton Tribeca New York, not only for their excellent service but for the accommodations they provide. I was traveling with my dogs and they provide to most amazing welcome to both myself and my dogs. The entire staff was very pet friendly and welcoming. We were also fortunate enough to use the lounge on the 21st floor which had views of the entire city as well as superb 24 hour food and beverage service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: stevenhellmann
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Tribeca for 3 nights in December 2010 (right around the time of the storm). All in all, a fantastic stay. The location is prime for any lover of NYC, as, you are a good distance away from the tourist traps. Lowell (the General Manager) was very accommodating with all of our requests and put in a room with a second to none view of the Empire State Building and the Manhattan skyline. Amazing view. Could not stop looking out the window. The rooms were clean, with a good sized shower and uber comfortable king bed. Modern amenities (chairs, television, desk, etc.). The free bottle of water daily was a nice touch. The only downfall is that there is no in-room safe or fridge, although there is a room to keep your valuables behind reception. The staff was very polite, however, unfortunately, I did not find them as knowledgeable as they could have been. They did not have many good recommendations/tips, and, did not seem to know the surrounding area too well. That would be my only criticism. Otherwise, a great stay. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “For the money...look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sselhorst
Reviews.Content: The service was average. The room was rather ugly. Our television broke on our second evening, and our request to fix it was untimely, despite the front desk's promise to send someone directly up to look at it. Also, the sconce in the room was broken as well as one of the electrical outlets I attempted to plug the hair dryer into. My biggest complaints were with the bathroom. The shower fixture was designed in such a way as to require one to blast oneself with cold water before arriving at the required temp, and the bath towels were rough and nearly as skimpy as the hand towels. Also, the toiletries provided are sub par. To have your linens replaced you have to have read one of the many in-room memos posted about the room, which state that this is only done upon special request. Finally, as we were leaving we were asked by the bellhop when we wished to depart (we checked out several hours later and were storing our bags at the hotel), and offered car service. Inquiring as to how much this would be, we were told $54, which is ridiculous, considering that we were able to catch our own cab for $20. Also, the way in which we were asked seemed to imply that it was somehow standard procedure. To a visitor unfamiliar with the ease with which one might secure a cab to LGA, I can see where they might prey on their guests.For the price, and considering the amenities offered by comparable hotels (terry cloth robes, newspapers, free wireless) I would look elsewhere for a hotel with more character. Would certainly not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: MDWarlick
Reviews.Content: Our group was snowed in during the blizzard. However, though there were 170 passengers being checked in at 6am, Steven Lamour and his staff provided outstanding service getting all checked in. Even though I needed to change rooms a couple of times through no fault of his own, he never became flustered. I highly recommend this hotel to travellers. When the conditions are trying, I have learned that the best people shine. Steven is one of those people.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel--run very very well--especially Steven Lamour”
Reviews.Author: doberman32
Reviews.Content: Was on my way to Cairo when the blizzard hit. Stayed at the Sheraton-Tribeca under very difficult circumstances. Arrived at 330 AM with about 200 other people. I stay at Sheratons all over the world and this was one of the nicest. The staff was great and in particular, the Sheraton manager who handled all of us was really great. His name was Steven Lamour and he was extremely professional and kind in extremely difficult circumstances. Will absolutely choose to stay at this hotel in the future because of this treatment. Thank you. The hotel itself is very modern and nice; Rooms are very nice and great beds. Good gym and the location of the hotel is unbeatable. Good food as well.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the lounge, not the gym”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorBizman
Reviews.Content: As I write this review the hotel has only been open for a few months. It is my second stay at this Tribeca location. The lobby is in the new "Aloft" like style for Sheratons - copy Sheraton Brooklyn but larger space. The small gym was ill conceived. For example, the flat screen tv is on the wall behind all the cardio equipment so your back faces it. Maybe this is just their temporary gym. It definitely needs a redesign. What the hotel lacks in the gym, it surely makes up for in its Platinum lounge. They serve a fairly good breakfast, but the best part is the outside deck. Weather permitting, the rooftop outside patio views are great. Perfect place to reserve for a party. One big issue I encountered on both visits is the desert like dry air in the rooms. Front desk does not stock any humidifiers. Trust me, it is very very dry. It is a new hotel, so expect unpolished service for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Shiny, bright, and expensive if you're not a sardine”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: Situated on a nondescript block of Canal Street between Tribeca and Soho, this brand-new hotel is shiny and bright, literally: Indoor lighting is blinding everywhere, in the lobby and hallways (except for the restaurant, which is lit like a nightclub). This is unfortunate, since the decor -- a kind of heavy modernist/wood retro thing -- would benefit from a bit softer atmosphere. The current low room rates ($250 is the least expensive rate offered on the hotel's web site) are tempting, but as I discovered, that rate will only get you an extremely small room that's barely big enough to accommodate the king-size bed, too small for two people to do anything other than sleep and jostle to get by each other while en route to the bathroom or the tiny armoire which is the hotel's version of a closet in that size of room. So I opted to upgrade to their "studio suite", which was nothing more than a normal sized room -- and for that was forced to pay over $500, a rate that could have gotten us into a dozen other far more comfortable and appealing hotels in Manhattan which don't feel like a chain hotel. Oddly Sheraton has put the "studio suite" on each floor not in a corner but in the middle of the main hallway right next to the Coke machine + ice machine, enabling one to hear hallway conversations through the relatively thin door. Once in the "studio suite", I discovered that the bathroom fan was so noisy, and triggered by the bathroom light, that it might awaken your companion if you visited the bathroom while he/she was sleeping, and that using the internet cost another $25 per day. The windows were double-glazed, but traffic noise was still noticeable. The overly active HVAC unit was too efficient, streaming out cool air if you wanted only to lower the temperature a degree or two, or hot air if you wanted just to slightly warm it up. But somehow that went along with the clunky room furniture, which was upholstered to look like it was designed to withstand annual conventions of professional wrestlers. This isn't a hotel with any subtlety. Its use of space and choice of decor is tolerable only for short stays by those who don't plan to do anything in their room except sleep. The only saving grace is a faultlessly gracious and helpful staff, from the bellmen to the front desk to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Wanda08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my friends for a girls weekend. It was great! The staff was amasing! They were friendly, and truly went out of there way to make things as easy and comfortable as possible. There is a good little coffee shop that serves Starbucks and pastries in the lobby and there is a nice internet center with several computers and a printer available. The rooms are very clean and modern but have cool old pictures of NYC which I really liked. The beds were amasing!! So comfortable with big fluffy pillows and down comforters. Bathrooms were beautiful too and had everything you need including fog free mirrors which I thought was a nice touch. The rooms are a little tight but still very comfortable. Also, hotel had town cars available to guests, that are a little more expensive than cabs, but totally worth it if you need to get somewhere at dinner time on the weekend. We really had an enjoyable stay, and for a new hotel things really run very smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have worked out better....”
Reviews.Author: Ozbuzz
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. I came in last minute and found this hotel. Very easy to check in, very friendly valet, doorman, and front desk receptionist. The hotel seems brand new, so the room was very clean and well designed!

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: herbertpolster
Reviews.Content: Positives: - Great staff who try very hard and are extremely helpful - Very clean - Good location, close to both SoHo and downtown -> perfect for a business trip with leisure weekends included - Some nice rooms available with amazing views of Empire State building - Nice members lounge with great views: lots of facilities and breakfast - Generally very comfortable - Excellent wireless internet in the entire hotel (free for Platinum guests) and a lot of options on TV - Good value for money for NYC - Pretty quiet, given location Negatives/constructive criticism: - Gym: currently mainly has machinery for cardio - only 1 multi-purpose machine for weight training (when occupied, you can’t do any training). This could easily (and cheaply) be fixed by getting some free weights - lets hope this gets done soon. - Some processes don't work 100% yet, e.g. deliveries to the hotel could sometimes not be found until a day later, since there's about 3 different places in the hotel where they could be stored - Some small things additionally in the room would’ve been nice at times: Fridge/mini-bar, pay-per-view - I'm an SPG Platinum member and still had to ask for upgrades every time. You generally do not get the feeling that SPG status makes a huge difference to your treatment until you make it an issue. I’m looking forward to staying here again and hope some of my criticism will be improved over the coming weeks/months. Then this hotel will become a 5 star rating very quickly…

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: Londoncritic2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time at the Sheraton Tribeca and I have to say I was blown away from the second I entered the hotel. I am travelling a lot around the world for business and I didnt think I could be still suprised by attentive service. The staff are so friendly, helpful and sincere and over the 4 days of my stay I can just say, the team just get it right!!! Nothing is too much to ask, there is always a smile and help when you need it. The concierge is friendly and is giving great suggestions for the new findings in New York. The location is just perfect with Soho just being 5 min away, the subway a 2 min walk. The rooms are great, fantastic beds and a walk in shower. Would definitely to recommend to stay again and have so already to many of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Shiny New!”
Reviews.Author: UK-Milkybarkid
Reviews.Content: Let's hope their enthusiasm lasts. All staff are friendly, jolly and falling over themselves to assist you. The rooms are spacious, clean and the showers are better than the average Sheraton. The restaurant was quiet and given the meat-packer district is just around the corner not surprising but the food was fresh and tasty, with the waiter very enthusiastic and attentive. The only issue - they need more training in the bar - the cocktails were not up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Great Location, Great Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: rbelknap
Reviews.Content: The new Sheraton Tribeca was everything I could of wished for in a NYC hotel. Great value, great location convienent to subway, financial district, SOHO food/dining and entertainment. Lobby was built for the seasoned traveller with all the amenities to support a trip for business of pleasure. Great Staff.

Reviews.Title: “not a Sheraton, but ok”
Reviews.Author: Resende99
Reviews.Content: The first thing that attracst us to the hotel was the location, no complain about that. The hotel is close to two train stations and nice restaurants, it is relatively easy to get to anywhere including to and from the airports. The second thing was the "Sheraton" brand, but the Sheraton Tribeca, is not a real Sheraton, perhaps a small brother or sister, but defenitvely not a Sheraton. The rooms are clean, the service is helpful, the price is of a Sheraton but it is not a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “A great new find in Manhatten!”
Reviews.Author: oldskool66
Reviews.Content: I am staying at this brand new hotel and am very pleased. The staff are extremely friendly and showed quite a bit of concern when I had to wait about 15 minutes for my room to become available upon check in. Location is extremely convenient. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “BRAND NEW HOTEL, right NEAR Subway line”
Reviews.Author: luvtakintrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this brand new Sheraton Tribecca hotel in November 2010. The brand new hotel (built from the ground up...it used to be a parking lot) opened in October 2010. Everything obviously was brand new in the hotel (and still had that "new" smell). The staff was super-friendly. There was 1 free hour for Internet service with the computers in the lobby. There was a restaurant and a separate bar if you would be interested. However, the great thing we liked was the location in relation to the subway line (the blue lines A, C, and E trains). The subway was right around the corner from the hotel. The A, C, and E subway trains take you to Greenwich Village, Penn Station/Madison Square Garden, 42nd Street/Times Square, and the World Trade Center/PATH station. The hotel itself is right on Canal Street, with the Chinatown and Little Italy neighborhoods just a few blocks away. There's also lots of fun discount shopping and street vendors lined along Canal Street. Based on the great location, the nice quiet room, friendly staff, but extremely clean, brand-new hotel, we would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: NCPETE
Reviews.Content: Great place - Rooms are very small but very nice. Great lounge for gold members. Nice rooftop place that you have a great view from. Nicest NYC hotel ever ( have stayed at the Sheraton Manhattan - UGH).

Reviews.Title: “Best Bartender in the WORLD!”
Reviews.Author: n0_n0nsense_traveler
Reviews.Content: So here is the deal, if your coming to New York and you are not planning on staying here then you have already messed up. This hotel is BRAND NEW, not even 2 months old. I am always traveling on business, and have been to every major hotel in New York pretty much. This time I decided to bring my family, and show them a good time. At the reccomendation of a friend who stayed here in October, and was extremely satisfied I booked here. From our speedy check-in, to the killer mojitos and cocktails the bartender made for me it was amazing. My friend Susan said that I should only go to the bar when Robert was there. Let me tell you, most bartenders only want to get you drunk or suck up to you to get a nicer tip. This kid let me tell you is not like that. My wife, and I had lunch at the bar and were planning our day when he came and started telling us all the best places in New York. From museums, to the best broadway play. He told us the secrets for getting around the city fast and easy, and saved my wife and I a lot of time planning our day out. HE WAS MORE HELPFUL THEN THE CONCIERGE! He makes amazing drinks, and has a personality that very hard to come by in New York. Also the front desk manager steven is amazing! He is super friendly, and the General Manager is friendly as well. He approached my wife and I and we spoke briefly for about 3 minutes. So long story short, I will be bringing my family back here for many more years to come. The hotel is not your ordinary hotel in many ways, I am still in awe at how the sheraton found so many great people to work there. Kudos to their human resources department!

Reviews.Title: “You may be pleasantly surprised...I was!”
Reviews.Author: FineDiner74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a full week during Thanksgiving and were very happy with most everything about this new hotel. It is wonderfully located between midtown and downtown with immediate access to all major subway lines. The shopping in nearby SoHo & Tribeca is wonderful. Traffic on Canal is congested because of the Holland Tunnel approaches and avoid the stretch of Canal just east of the hotel to avoid busloads of foreign tourists buying crappy souvenirs (although they're handy if you need a fast umbrella or ear muffs). The rooms are smallish but complete and perfect for a solo businessperson...we were a couple and made do just fine for the entire week. The shower is big and really nice...plenty of amenities too! Closet space is spare. They do have larger rooms available which I would recommend looking into for longer stays than overnite. Corner rooms with two windows look really nice and the "05" rooms on each floor are large. Higher floors are nicer because of the views which are stupendous. Try to use your Starwood status to bump up to larger accommodations. You may as well avoid the SPG floors because they provide nothing extra special as far as I could tell. They do a VERY nice job in the Club Lounge on the 21st Floor providing FULL breakfast, snacks, coffee drinks and beverages all day (24 hour access) and very tasty canapes with cash bar service in the evenings. Thomasz (?) makes a MAD $14. dirty martini!! The staff is full of smiles and helpful attitudes...if/when I needed anything they were reliably there for me.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience I've had in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Waverley050
Reviews.Content: Staff so friendly and helpful that it didn't feel like I was in New York! Rooms well appointed, very comfortable and immaculately maintained. Stayed on concierge level where breakfast was wonderful and we could request anything else we wanted. Easy access to Tribeca, Soho and Brooklyn Bridge - not bad to other parts of the city by subway. Would definitely stay here again. Only downside was trying to get a taxi at rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed at over 50 NYC hotels and this is one of the nicest”
Reviews.Author: sabbate
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. I typically travel to NYC on business but this was a combo business and leisure stay. I stay around 20 nights a year in Manhattan and over the years I have stayed in at least 50 different hotels. The staff at this hotel are some of the nicest people, which can be a rarity in NYC. They have the New York energy without the typical New York attitude (I am from NY originally). The beds were unbelievably comfortable and there was very little to no street noise. The room was an average size for NY and it had all the amenities. Nice bathroom with great water pressure in the shower. Free internet was easy to get on and very fast. Good restaurants in the area and easy access to the subway. The doorman was able to get a cab quickly even on a busy day. The hotel is right on Canal Street which I thought would be an issue, but it is actually a positive. All the shops are just a short distance away and I needed to pick up a birthday present for my daughter. There is a Starbucks in the hotel and they had a good selection of food there as well. The views are fantastic (see if you can get a room with a view of Midtown). There are no tall buildings in the way of the view and you can see the empire state building and Midtown skyline. It looks particularly nice at night. The empire state building was lit up in tye dye for a Grateful Dead type concert that night. That was really cool. I usually have some negative comments, but I really can't think of anything. This is a gem of a hotel. I will be bringing the family on my next trip. There is a lot to keep them busy in the area while I visit clients. This hotel may be a few dollars more than some others, but how much is a good night's sleep worth when you are doing business or pleasure in NY. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing, RUDE staff, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Theresa75
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, and to be honest- this was one of the worst experiences I have ever had at any hotel. I was only in NY for one day and night, and spent 3 hours of it waiting to be allowed into my room. Check-in was at 3pm, and I finallly got into my room around 5:45pm. I even arrived at 2pm to see if I could check in early. The lat the front desk said there were problems with the cleaning staff, and they were still working on my room, and it would only be about a 20 minute wait. One hour later they said they could not reach the maids to see what was going on. I spent 4 hours just sitting and waiting in the hotel lobby with my luggage, while I could have been out doing what I went to NY in the first place for. It was obvious after I was finally let into my room at 5:45pm that is was not a problem caused by the cleaning staff as I was told. This was a blatant lie on the front desk\'s part. There was no cleaning staff in sight- in fact, the shower was not even clean. I will never stay at a Sheraton again. There is no excuse for this, nobody who pays for a room should be made to wait for 3 hours AFTER check-in to get into a room, it is completely unfair, and a total rip-off- even at the discounted rate I was able to get. I did not get what I paid for. By the time I got my luggage into my room, I only had until 7 pm before most of the stores in that area (which was not in the safest spot) closed for the night. This was a big waste of my time and money. The front desk staff was RUDE and snobby. We did, however, eat at the restaurant there. The food was good, our server's name was August, and he was the only pleasant person in the hotel. Location is not the best, either. Neigherborhood is sketchy, but fairly close to good shopping. The staff is unwilling to resolve your problems, even if you call down.

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff--and they take dogs!”
Reviews.Author: underwaydd
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hundreds of hotels on four continents and the Sheraton Tribeca has by far the friendliest staff I've seen. What is more, they are friendly in a sincere and helpful way, not in the forced cheer you often encounter. The location is terrific, the windows open (yay,) free computers in the lobby aren't crowded, parking works, the food is good, and for those with small children who wake up at ungodly hours, there is a deli next door. And did I mention, they take dogs?

Reviews.Title: “Hotels Best Front Office Manager”
Reviews.Author: johnbanking
Reviews.Content: My first couple of days at the Sheraton tribeca was the worst; I woke up to horrible drilling noise and door slams the good thing is that I did receive a letter by the front office manager the day prior stating this but wow. My business plan was cut short due to a small fever, I called the front desk asking for a room move with piece and quiet (stating I wasn’t feeling well and just needed rest) Steven Amour came and apologized for the inconvenience and assisted with the room move. An hour later he personally came up and brought a bowl of soup for me. Steve is not your common manager; he empathized and showed sympathy .............. what a great asset this hotel hired. you will definitely be seeing me again ...........................JB

Reviews.Title: “Great four days”
Reviews.Author: Wooffey
Reviews.Content: My daughter was running in the NY Marathon and she invited me at the last moment to be her ‘Official Supporter’ and we stayed here four nights, the Hotel was recommended by friends of hers. Ruth Lopez, Director of Revenue Management, was particularly helpful giving me Marathon Tips, and when she completed the Marathon a signed Card and Foot Balm from the team. We had a Club Room on 21st Floor with great views over Manhattan; we particularly enjoyed the well stocked Lounge, although the Hostess was lax at clearing the tables, preferring to talk to other guests. As in previous reports we noticed the gap @ the bottom of the door allowing noise from the corridor. In all other respect the room was adequate. On the day of our departure we were annoyed when the Room Attendant woke us by knocking on the door @ 8.30 am Centrally located hotel, helpful staff especially those front of house, clean & brand new so well maintained at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “IF YOU WANT TO GET CHARGED 3 TIMES FOR THE SAME NIGHT--STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: snapperb69
Reviews.Content: I stayed ONE NIGHT at this hotel and had to make 28 phone calls to finalize my trip and for them to give me a confirmation number. The communication between the reservations dept and the front desk is ABSOLUTELY HORRIFYING. I WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!! Good luck to you if you stay and check your credit card often. It is a week later and I am still calling to get the charges taken care of. NOT WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not finished and rooms are noisy”
Reviews.Author: JohanneEE
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in November - we have previously only had good experiences with Sheraton hotels but this definitely feels like a discount version. The hotel is new built but doesn't feel quite finished. The rooms are drafty, there is a big gap under all the doors which lets in all the noise from the corridors, and there is also lot of noise from Canal Street (windows not sound proof). We had to move rooms twice - the first room we stayed in had an extremely small window and felt more like a prison cell, the second one was so noisy that you couldn't sleep or think - the one we finally ended up in was quite but very small. Whilst the staff are friendly and accomodating, this felt like bad value for money and we were quite disappointed with our stay.
